text: The pizza was okay. Not the best I've had. I prefer Biaggio's on Flamingo / Fort Apache. The chef there can make a MUCH better NY style pizza. The pizzeria @ Cosmo was over priced for the quality and lack of personality in the food. Biaggio's is a much better pick if youre going for italian - family owned, home made recipes, people that actually CARE if you like their food. You dont get that at a pizzeria in a casino. I dont care what you say...

came here on Monday, no line. its good, but not to go out of your way good.  price is reasonable, it is hard to find. but that was the fun of it trying to find it.  no name, no sign.  if your clubbing @ the Cosmo and your have the munchies this is your place.  they use fresh toppings, crust is thin and very tasty.

This place is truly a secret!  Its so hidden that there are no signs in the directory of the restaurant itself except for the line of people waiting to enjoy a slice of the best pizza they ever had.  It is thin crust pizza, crispy crust and delicious toppings!  If you can go for lunch there is less of a line.
Their pepperoni was nice and oily just the way i like it

This SECRET  PIZZA was a secret for about 5 stays at the Cosmo. Now that I know where it is its my favorite late night snack. Ask for it well done and the crust will be perfect. The staff was great, they actually recognized me from the night before....I guess I've become a regular.

this is the BEST place to grab a quick slice of pizza. It's right on your way leaving Marquee, the employees are so friendly, and the pizza tastes just as good when you're as it does when you're drunk ;)

Never heard about this "Secret Pizza" place but my friends say they are the best and it was on a show. Well let me tell you this, it's the best pizza I've ever had. The white pizza is definitely the one to get. Just writing this review is making me hungry and craving for it even though I just had it like 4 hours ago.

Secret pizza is a hidden gem inside The Cosmopolitan.  If you're looking to get a quick slice of pizza before heading out on the strip this is the place to check out. Best slice of pepperoni I've had in Vegas!

this place is good, real good. the pizza in my opinion is a bit pricy for the slice you get. if the slice was a bit bigger it'd be worth it. the slice i got was a little bigger than your average chain pizza joints. if im in the area, will not hesitate to come back.

Mmmm. Reminds me of the pizza back in NYC, where I'm from. And I have high standards when it comes to pizza!

The first time we passed by, it was about 1am and the line was wrapped down the hallway and around the pool table. We went back the next day for a quick bite after some shopping and we were glad we did.  

I'll definitely be back for more, as most of the pizza in Vegas is inedible.

This place is a hidden gem... literally hidden.  I'm not gonna go into too much detail, cuz I don't want too many tourists crowding the place and have it lose it's cool, speaky-easy-ness.  You'll just have to find it.  (Think of it as a fun game.)

The pizza is frickin' awesome.  The crust is thin and perfect.  
And for the price, including a drink, it's an amazing value for a quick bite, or for some late night gnoshing after some drinking.

Don't think that you'll be able to go and gather around a table.  It's not a pizza parlour.  Stools.  Counter tops.  Pizza.  Beer.  Awesome.

If you want to feel like a Vegas baller without spending a fortune, spend some time at the GORGEOUS Cosmopolitan hotel, check out the amazing shops and grab a slice of two of pizza at the Pizzeria. While it's certainly not the best pizza I've ever had, it's quick, cheap, and an entire group of friends from vegetarians to meat lovers can carbo load before a night of heavy drinking.
Wanted to like this more, but was not impressed. Tried pepperoni and a plain Sicilian. Line was long of course, and was hopeful due to the reviews. Very similar to Town Pizza in Highland Park LA.

I'm not much of a "review or feedback" person but this place is worth me signing up for a yelp account !!! It's the best pizza I have ever had hands down .... Like most newbees I had a hard time finding it here is a post that helped me find it : 

"Take escalators to restaurant floor (third floor). At top of escalators you will be facing Jaleo. Immediately on the left of this restaurant is a (narrow by Vegas standards) hallway - the pizza place is down this hallway. You'll see people indulging in pizza by the pool table in this area and know you've hit the right spot. :)

best,

the pokerfoodie"

If you stay on the strip and don't hit this place at least once your missing out big time!!!!

Definitely a MUST-TRY if you are nearby cosmo and are: 1) hungry AF and/or 2) drunk AF. You will not regret ordering the white pizza. The whole pizza, if you can. I'm not kidding. It's THAT good (plus you save a little $ per slice, too and that's always a good thing!) And another awesome thing about this place is how it's awesome late! Perfect to come straight here right after Marquee lol (no yacking pls) but expect a long line due to other drunkies with the munchies *nom*

If I could only rate this place off the chart. BEST PIZZA on the strip!!!!! It's super fast paced so don't expect to sit. If your that kind of snob then don't bother reviewing. It's all about the pizza at this place. The pizza has this little crunch of perfection when you first bite it and it's orgasmic! It's so delicious!! I can't talk about it enough. I love coming here so, I never pass an opportunity to bring my out of town friends here... wish their was a local discount lol

Had the thin crust meatball and sausage pizza. Delicious flavor and the crust is perfect. Big slices of meatballs with massive flavor.  Highly recommended to ask for parmesan to sprinkle on top. Solid slice for Vegas!

Awesome"after the club" pizza place!! Cool staff, generous slices and you gotta try the white slice!! I was staying in the Cosmo and this place was recommended to me, so I have to pay it forward and tell you guys you gotta try it!! Enjoy!!

The pizza here is probably one of the best I've ever had .  They cook it  there in front of you - so you know it's fresh and boy does it taste good!

I am marking them down because their selection of toppings was so very poor.  When asked whether they did chicken or beef toppings, they said they only did ham and salami and looked at me as if I were crazy!!  What kind of pizza place doesn't have a chicken or beef option???  Weird!

Note that this is not really an eat in place, just a take out joint - well worth it though.
Great pizza, friendly and entertaining staff, and open late!

Personally the hype is not real... Perhaps it was extremely over-hyped up, maybe it was because I 100% sober haha. Idk it wasn't worth $28.50 for a pepperoni pizza. I live in Vegas and if you live here or visit I still think Verrazano Pizza and Rocco's Pizza are the best and waaay cheaper. 
We got the traditional pepperoni pizza and maybe that was my mistake because I hate salami pepperoni. If I happen to ever go back, I will try one slice of the raved white pizza. 
The price at Secret Pizza is RIDICULOUS... but what do you expect??? Vegas + Drunk people = Strip prices

Best pizza ever!  It was fun finding this place amd worth the time, offers pizza by the slice at a fair price. Guys running the place were super nice. If you need a late night snack this is the place to go while in Vegas.

This pizza was awesome!  It's not so "secret" anymore but it's worth seeking out for a slice. I had the white pizza after reading other reviews and it's was delish!  A little heavy on the garlic if that bothers you. It was perfect though for something greasy to help soak up the booze. 

You don't sit down here- you grab a slice, eat at the counter and go. You also don't go here for beverages- there selection is limited. You go here for the pizza and that's it. It took about 4 minutes to get our slices. Well worth the trip down to the Cosmopolitan for this pizza!!
This is a hidden place without a sign which adds a mystery to it which it true to its name. Pizza is wonderful. It is not fancy but good midnight spot.

Horrible customer service stay away!!...I waited in line for an hour bcuz of the hype from my friends...got to the front only to be told that I wouldn't be served bcuz I cut in line...the same line I patiently waited in for an hour...when it was finally made clear by all around I had not cut in line did I receive an apology?...nothing close...instead the rude lady who had told me I cut in line then said "look do you want to get served or not or get out of line!"...with a few choice words I told her no and left...asked to speak to a manager outside...got the head chef who sided with all of her actions based on previous people who had cut in line...moral of the story...you are just 3 bucks for what looked like an average piece of pizza to this place...and they will treat you like trash with no apologies if they feel like it...stay away!!!

Like all the other reviews mentioned, the pizza place is down a long hallway--walls decorated in album covers.  Pretty neat.  Pizza is pretty good.. thin crust..melty cheese.  Cheaper snack while you are on the strip.

No matter where you are in Las Vegas, this is one of the best Pizza places there is! Whether your drunk or sober, the pizza is a treat! Be mindful of what time you show up here tho, FRIDAY and SATURDAY nights the line can be out the door and down the hall, but still worth the wait! Their white pizza is a must and their meatball on any pizza is a must! Love this place!

The secret pizza shop is worth the search. I would give directions but I don't like getting people lost.   3rd floor of the cosmopolitan shopping center, then ask another restaurant for directions. 
   Great old school NY pizza. Good prices, slices, great staff, nice variety. A great escape from the craziness of vegas, although I was there at 11 am on a Tuesday in December.

I love the secret pizza shop! this place is soo good. 

Came here on two separate occasions. First time was around 1am on a Saturday (er..Sunday morning) and the line was long. Took about 20 min to get to the front and my oh my...the drunkards have come full force. 

I suppose being sober in the cosmopolitan at that time next to the exit of one of the strips most popular clubs doesnt help. But we ordered a whole pie...their white pizza which consisted of olive oil, onions, mozzarella, ricotta, and gahhhhlic. Then we kicked it up with muchrooms and sliced meatball. OMG A. Maze. Ing. It was so good. the new york thin crust and the mounds of ricotta...just a taste explosion in your mouf. 

Only thing was it cost quite a bit...30 bucks to be more specific. But it was worth it...it was vegas...and what ever..splurge. 

Next day went back and got a slice of classic peperoni. Still...super great and was really good. 

Soda and beer are served in red cups (same ones u buy at local costco or wherever) and its free refills (soda). i dont know what would happen if you brought your own from pre gaming in your hotel...

Went to the restaurant next door and played some fooseball...that was a blast. the pool table had broken cues...but what do you expect.

The place is located on the 3rd floor between two restaurants...a japanese and a spanish. it has a large wooden door with no sign...
This is very good pizza and unique place. I order pepperoni pizza. Oh taste so good. I will comeback to try different kind of pizza. Highly recommend!

This place is great after a night of heavy drinking!

The white pizza is my personal favorite.  The offer a white deep dish pizza on occasion that is absolutely heavenly!

There is sometimes a line but there are pin ball and arcade games to keep you entertained while you wait.  The restaurant is small but very retro feeling.  I go here every time I'm in Cosmo.

The pizza was tender and delicious.   It just melts in your mouth.  I love round table's king arthur, but this pizza just melts in your mouth.  I devoured my slice in a flash.  My brother and I then bought a large and devoured that as well.  Pizza lovers have to come here.  It is on the expensive side for a slice of pizza, but overall is an amazing experience.

Great new york style pizza. Some of the toppings are not what you expect. The sausage and meatball are actually shaved which gives it a nice consistency. Before they serve your pizza, they give it a toast which makes the thin crust crispy. Real nice.

This place was so hidden that some of the Cosmo staff couldn't direct us in the right direction. 

I thought it was good, very greasy, and full of cheese. Only downfall is that they don't have ham. I luv ham, so a pizza without ham is like rice without meat, water without ice, and a shower without soap to me. Basically, it's a necessity to me. The huge pepperoni slices and sliced meatballs was filling, but it would have tasted better with ham. 

Not very many seats and it gets crowded because of the small space inside. We ordered a fresh made whole pizza and took it outside to sit on the large couches inside Cosmo. It was much more comfier outside and less noisy. 

I liked it, but I wish they had ham.

One of those places where myth is better than reality.
Not a real hard place to find, not a hideway nor a secret place.
Located on 3rd floor and you'll see a large black door with a hallway  when you get off the escalator. Opens at 11:00 am. if you go before, you'll miss it for sure since they close the large door.
It's definitely a good pizza but definitely not the best. Probably best you can get around the area but you can get so much better even in LA.
$5.00 a piece but ridiculous $3.25 for a drink. Go to 2nd floor store right below and get a soda.
we tried mushroom pizza and white pizza.

Great pizza. Make sure you go. Don't work too hard trying to find the secret location, just ask so you can get there fast. As simple as pizza is, many mess it up. Secret Pizza has it figured  out. My NY friend even loved it. Wait varies. Last time I went, I walked straight up and ordered. Nice staff.

Fellow yelpers this is a great place, I'm from New Jersey and we know good pizza..  :)  This place is awesome, no signs or advertising just hidden spot whose location is only spread by word of mouth.  Located down a long unmarked corridor.  No map in the hotel reveals its location.   Also opened later than anything else in a area to get good food when you are drinking and hungry

When you walk in the first thing you'll notice is the long line of people..   (The secret is out) Mostly eat-in slices sold (about 5.50 a slice/30 bucks a pie), less than a dozen seats and counter space and twice as many people than seats..  We ordered 2 pies (4 types) and we asked them to pick their most popular mixes...  So the first was the white pie..  Simple, thin crust Mozzarella and ricotta but the whole pie was soaked is an olive oil/ butter garlic mix that was off the hook! My favorite..   The second was normal red Pie pepperoni and sausage.. The pepperoni was great but overly greasy and the sausage was weird looking but tasted good.  Next was a plain Cheese, sauce and mozzarella.  It was good but nothing to write home about except for the fact that this was good east coast pizza in Vegas! The last was a veggie mix of black olives, peppers and onions.. Overall really solid pizza..  

Shhhh- 3rd floor off the escalators.  Look for the long hallway..

Secret Pizza was the first stop of my friend's 22nd birthday celebration last month. She had heard so much about it that she absolutely had to include it. You know the drill. Whatever birthday girl says, goes.

This place really is hidden in The Cosmo though. Basically, you're looking for this random hallway. That's all I'll spill. Can't spoil it too much for everyone right?

We had seven people in our group, so we waited, and waited, then waited some more. It took a while to reach that point in line where you could see the menu and prices posted on a wall. I realize that they also fulfill phone orders from the hotel's guests, but we were practically forced to order individual slices because waiting for a whole pizza would take an hour. Anyway, we each finally got our $5 pizza slices after at least 30 minutes, then walked out to stand around and munch on 'em.

To be frank, the pizza was decent, but overhyped and not worth the wait or price.

Might be hard to find if you don't know about it, but I think it might be better that way.

Reasonably priced slices, and probably the best pizza on the strip. There was no line when I went but I could see there being a bit of a wait if you went later on in the night or ordered an entire pie.

Next time I'll be sure to bring a quarter or two as well to enjoy the arcade machines while I'm eating instead of heading straight back out into the casino.
Awesome service and tasty pizza! Wanted to try their white pizza but will save it for next time

As soon as we heard about this place, we wanted to try it. We had 2 slices: a fluffy, square one (not sure exactly what they called it) and a pepperoni.

The square one was amazingly delicious with it's cheese and meat. It definitely hits the spot and satisfies the pizza craving, especially if you're a fan of a fluffy, Pizza Hut-type pizza. This is by far, the better. The pepperoni was great. I feel that a lot NY style pizzas are decent and this is far better than decent, but not as good as that darn square one. Big fan, will be back again before heading home.
Late night pizza at its finest. One of the few places open late after a long night on the strip.  ricotta and garlic hit the spot.

Best kept secret for some delicious pizza! Pepperoni is my favorite! Line can get pretty long and there isn't much space to sit and eat. We took our pizza to second floor and found a lounge area to eat.

Heard a lot about this place so decided to check it out. Thought it would be fun to search for but it really wasn't hidden at all. 5 dollars for a slice? Okay not bad.. 4 dollars for a soda?? More expensive than Disneyland but didn't mind, of course until I received my soda in a red Solo cup. 4 dollars for a red solo cup??? No thanks! All in all the pizza was okay

Great place!!! Will definitely come back!
A slice for around $5-$6 but huge and delicious, can't complain. 

The sausage and pepperoni is where it's at! The sausage is better than the average little pieces of sausage you'd find at other places. I've tried pin up pizza and this place I'd have to say, tops it in taste.


They offer parm, red pepper, and garlic at the table!

I was staying at the Cosmopolitan and heard about this place but, since I had meetings at most of my meals during my stay, it wasn't the sort of place that fit my schedule.
But, on the day I was leaving Las Vegas I wanted something quick and filling to hold me over until I got back to Phoenix and I hunted this place down.

I guess when The Cosmopolitan first opened it was fun finding this "hidden" place. But, the word it out and other yelpers have even posted photos of the hallway to look for.  However, if you aren't paying attention and maybe you're a bit hung over it would be possible to walk right past it.

They mostly serve pizza by the slice with a number of selections available so you can go in, order, eat, and leave.  They'll also make you a pie but you'll have to wait for it.

The pizza is NY style and it was excellent! By Las Vegas standards, not too expensive.
Great spot for a good casual meal off the beaten path.
This was honestly the best pizza I've ever had.  If you want to keep things simple or if you're sick of eating buffets all day, stop by here and give their pizza a try.

It's in a "relatively" easy place to find. The wait times are usually super long. But it's the cheapest/best food you can probably find in Vegas. There's also a nice pool table outside, so if you come with friends, you can hang out for sometime.
This place has good pizza, stick to less toppings and you'll be happier. At around 10pm this spot seems to be like a pilgrimage for drunk women so be prepared to wait.

This little gem has no sign an is down a small, non-descript hallway to the right of the sushi place in the Cosmopolitan, Blue Ribbon (3rd floor east tower).

They sell by the slice or for entire pies. Four of us split a pepperoni pie after watching Cirque du Soleil's "O" and drinking a fair amount. Best pizza I've had in awhile! Highly recommend you add it to your Vegas experience -- open late, when it's best.

Yes, yes and yes. Go up to the 3rd floor and walk forward from the escalators. You'll see an unmarked hallway and then you'll smell pizza... So good. Both their new York style crust and Sicilian are great. The white pie has garlic and cheeses. Ricotta to be specific!! So good. You won't regret this nice little break from the craziness of Vegas!

Love the texture of the crust and the constantly different kind of pizza popping out of there oven. W were the first one to get there.  Ordered a slice of pepperoni and a slice of sausage and peppercino. Then went back after that a split a slice of a different kind of sausage and ricotta pizza. Big groups I recommend maybe getting a whole pie and customizing it.

Because this place is somewhat of a secret it makes the pizza even more special.

This pizza is really impossible not to love, if you like pizza. This is that greasy NY style, big slice, perfect cust pizza that you crave. 

If you're cool enough to find this place, welcome to the cool club but keep it a secret.

My friend told me about this great spot and I am SO glad she did!  It was the perfect cure in the afternoon for our hangover & we loved it so much so that we drunkenly returned that evening for a slice.  Worth the wait in line!  Total NY style pizza and super yummy!

First, we couldn't find the place. It is between Blue Ribbon Sushi Bar & Grill and Jaleo. When we went there, there was such a long line we just left. 

But, we didn't realize there isn't any seating (well there are a couple of bar stools), and the line moves along at a pretty decent rate. We came back the next day and tried again and this time we waited in line. 

The pizza tasted fine except for it being very greasy. The customer service was very good, but I wouldn't go there again because the food was nothing special. I'm sure the quality of ingredients is good, but it's pizza, and it is not hard to find great pizza.

Honestly, nothing special. First thing that popped in my head... the pizza from Costco tastes better. It's very over priced. My husband and I bought 3 slices total and one soda. That was $22. Honestly would not go back. 

If you're looking to buy a whole pizza, expect to pay anywhere from $27-35. Sodas are $4 each (a red solo cup full).
Very good pizza. Loved the record cover hallway. Fun to be in on the secret. It's a busy place with not much seating but there's a lounge area nearby that most people use.

Really scrummy pizza. I played Ms Pacman for the first time in decades...I am still rubbish at it, but what fun! There isn't much else to say about this hidden gem. Would you go here for a candlelight dinner for two? Nope. Could it be the best slice in Vegas? Quite possibly.

(Later edit: I have been back when I was the designated driver and had to up it to 5 stars! Not only is it the best slice in Vegas...it could be the best slice in the WORLD! Seriously!! It's THAT good)
Great low key pizza spot. The crust is crunchy and chewy. They were fast. It was tough to find, which made it fun.

If you want NY style pizza, find this place and order one.

Classic NY style pizza, done quite well.  I prefer the straight cheese pizza, but their specialty is the "white" pizza, which is also very good.  takes about 20 minutes to get a pizza, or you can opt for a slice or two.  If it's after the clubs start closing down, who knows how long you'll be waiting.

 
It's on the 3rd floor in a small hallway to the left of Jalio (or however its spelled).  Small place, basically stand and eat.  They do have Hipster brew on tap though.  Reasonable prices and great flavor.

 
Also, the Cosmopolitan in general is probably the swankest place in Vegas right now.  I really dig it and it's a fun place to hang out.

Good, fast and cheap late night pizza at $5 a slice. 3rd floor in unmarked hallway. 
Crisp and tasty but pretty greasy so blot away

This Pizza is amazing! It's literally so good but I almost never get it because 1.) going to the cosmopolitan is a nightmare to drive to park ect. 2.) this artisan pizza takes a long time to make, and it's very busy so prepare to wait in line and then wait a long time for the pizza 3.) it's expensive when you're talking about pizza and 4.) while you sit there waiting 40 minutes for your pizza you will be in the company of the weirdest bunch of hipsters you will ever come across. All in all I will say the pizza is good, worth a try at least once.

We got the white pizza, delicious!!!!
Garlicky and amazingly yummy!
And the cannoli, delicious and not super expensive.
We are going back for more!
A really cool find on the Strip. A cool pizza joint hidden in the too fru fru for me Cosmopolitan.  Very good New York style pizza for not much $.  A must stop for all my future Las Vegas visits

My husband and I proclaimed to our friends that we were starving around midnight on a Wednesday while playing in Cosmo. So our friend tells us to go to the 3rd floor (it is the third floor, right?), walk passed the pool table, down a long hallway to get the BEST PIZZA.

I must say I was intrigued and would have never found this place on my own.

Pizza was good. Crisp Crust, Cooked all the way through (Hey, I live in DE, where no one can commercially cook a good pizza besides a handful of places!), cheese bubbly and alittle burned (just the way I like it!).

Surprisingly a great place to eat. Simple Food. Who would have thought you could find such a thing in Vegas!

Caught a morning flight and got in at lunchtime having eaten nothing all day. Staying at the Cosmo and remembered the pizza place. Super good. Awesome New York style so it's greasier than most regular pizzas, but just hits the spot. Only $5 for a slice too. Awesome place.

This place was perfect, quick, and friendly (but not putting up with b.s.) staff.   Make sure to ask if there's any fresh, out of the oven pizza, mmmmmm! White pizza had the perfect amount of garlic.  I can see how this gets ridiculously packed at like 2am.  Turn right after getting off the glass elevator on the third floor to get there.  Worth the detour!

OMG!!!!
This place is amazing! The girl who took my order was so awesome. There was some Irish dude and he was all "I already ordered right! Why is this taking so long???" And she was like "You ordered 3 pizzas! It's not Pizza Hut!" That pretty much shut him up! It was hilarious! My pizza was so good! It was hot too! The crust was super moist and flavorful. I would eat three pizzas if I could!

Besides being hidden and tucked away, this place is definitely a well known "secret".

After a hard night of partying at Marquee, I stopped by, passed out on the chairs outside of this pizzeria. My guy stood  in line for about 45 minutes (at 3am, there was still a long line!), and bought me a simple cheese pizza and it was HEAVENLY!!!!!!!

I came here 2 days ago and I am still thinking about how delicious my pizza was!

Disclaimer - it might have been "heavenly" because I was drunk, but my sober friends tell me it was as delicious as I thought it to be.

If the cheese pizza was that delicious, I had to take a bite from my guy's sausage and mushroom (that's what she said). The sausage had a nice pepper kick. It was probably one of the best pizza's I've ever had in my life.

Tip -  You might as well order 2 slices if you're going to wait in this line. This pizza is so damn good!

Pretty amazing, i must say. Slices are huge, and tastes like it just came off a flight from NYC. Service is okay. A couple of the emp's aren't so nice. But overall, this pizza is definitely legitimate.

Secret Pizza was one of the places we were looking forward to on our last trip because many people talk about it, and the reviews are awesome. It's located on the third floor of the Cosmo with other restaurants (I think it's the level with a pool table on it), down the hallway with all the pictures.

There was no line and we were able to get our pizza right away. Each slice is preheated, and one of the disappointing things is that both of our slices were overly salty.  The slices were good, but no where near the hype. And not anywhere near the quality of an authentic slice from NY.  I think the slices were $5-7 each, and beer was $7-8.

The service was OK and there is virtually no seating. The atmosphere is nice (arcade games, bar top seating, etc). But the pizza was just OK. We found the slice at Flour and Barley (at the Linq) was much better.
Great pizza found late at night. After a week of too much pizza this was the one I enjoyed the most. Highly recommended, it is of the slightly greasy New York style pizza. Exceptionally tasty.

Hey white slice pizza...I want you badly!  

This simple secret pizza joint found somewhere on the 3rd floor at the Cosmo in Vegas is serving crack pizza and they are calling it "The white slice"

I don't know what's on it, it's so simple and plain...just some kind of cheese and maybe some garlic? I dunno, but it is PHENOMENAL! I actually ordered a slice with a bunch of stuff on it cuz the "white slice" looked so plain, but I took a bite of my friend's and liked it better than the one I ordered! I went back and ordered it 2 more times. 

I think they close around 4am because when I first went to try it, it was closed :( I wanted to try it after seeing it featured on a TV show couple years ago and I always remembered it and boy am I sooo glad I did :) I dream about this pizza every night! I need this pizza in my life!!! 

THE SECRET'S OUT!!! :D

It really is a secret.  No sign.  I was walking down the strip and was searching yelp for a good restaurant.  I saw that I was .1 miles from it Secret Pizza.  Took a while to find it but once there, I found a beer and really good pizza.   I walked back from Mandalay Bay the next day for lunch too.

Jersey approved! Found this place by chance and was content from the get! Walked into a huge line and everyone raving about how good the pizza is. We couldn't decide on one so we decided to order 1/2 cheese 1/2 white and it was amazing! Definitely worth the cost and everyone seems to have been here more than once during their stay! A++

Overrated!  Overpriced!  They reheat their pizza, the guy pulled out a slice of cold pizza from underneath the counter and reheated for us.  Needless to say, it tasted like a day old pizza reheated in the microwave, who knows when it was cooked.... Compared to a Lombardi's white pizza, well there is no comparison.  The Secret Pizza was luke warm (that reheating thing does not work for me), the cheese was really chewy (baked hours ago), and the crust was not really that thin like a true NY pizza.  Overall, this place is way overrated and overpriced.  $6 for a slice of pizza is no deal......

This place should stay "secret," BTW, unlike many of the other reviews, I was sober when I ate the pizza....

We were in town and decided to have a little food adventure to find this place. We were a little disappointed because it wasn't as "hidden" as we thought it would be but that just may be because we hyped it up to ourselves so much. 

As far as the pizza, it was fine. A little too greasy for my taste but the pepperoni was tasty. So was it the best pizza I've ever eaten? Definitely not. Would it be very satisfying at 2am after some drinks? Absolutely.
yay best place to get some awesome tasty pizza and cheap ! while gambling in the cosmopolitan  ! love this place!

Holy little baby Jesus! This place is awesome! Ridiculously good. Awesome decor. Now... the only problem is finding it. But I think that may be a good thing lest it be overrun by drunk hillbilly's with giant blenders of frozen goop.
Delicious... New York style... Greasy cheesy and crispy!!! Mmmm if you're not a pizza lover don't come !!!

Overpriced, mediocre tasting pizza, staff is not friendly, and the menu does not reflect the other pizza slices they offer, which is inconveniently hidden out of sight. This place is right in front of Blue Ribbon restaurant and easily missed.
It would be 5 stars but I've had times where I waited 30 minutes and still couldn't get a pizza as the line was just waaaayy too long. Great place though.

Went here after reading other reviews.  Reasonable price and 1 slice was plenty for me.  A little greasy but the crust was thin and the cheese and toppings plentiful.    Would go again just because price is reasonable.

I haven't heard of this place until a few months ago. Of all the times I've been to Vegas, I can't believe I missed out on this "secret pizza". The place is really hidden but once you see the records on the wall then you are at the right spot. The place is small so space is limited. The pizza here is awesome !! The first bite of it will make you understand why this place is a secret. I ordered a slice of the sausage pizza and it was off the hook !!! I'm definitely coming back for my pizza cravings.

Really....?????
The pizza has no taste....
The worse pizza I ever have. Any other pizza is better than this junk. I brought my brother in law visiting from overseas, they just watched Le Reve at Wynn, so we went here, because he likes pizza. This shit has 2000 yelp reviews.... it's so embarrashing. The couple who sat next to us wanting to talk to me. They found this place from Yelp.

We Found Sbarro's Cool Cousin at the Cosmopolitan!

For us, it was part of our Las Vegas bucket list. So this place is not so secret, it's a matter of fact pretty easy to find, tucked away in a corner, third floor at the Cosmopolitan. Both my husband and I ordered the pepperoni pizza. The pizza was just ok and that's not saying much since we were sort of hungry. After leaving there we went to In and Out to complete our late night dining experience.

Best way to describe the pizza, just think Sbarro's when you were 13 years old and your mom dropped you off at the mall. You and your friends having a Sbarro's pepperoni pizza was a fun experience and tasted pretty good. However, here are some differences, Secret Pizza is a bit more greasy, more expensive, your old friends aren't there, and less sitting space than at the mall.

They really do try their best to offer the "cool" factor, and what could be cooler than a pinball machine and old record covers on the wall as you walk in. For this place, once you have done it, the odds are you won't be back. But a fun thing to do anyhow if you happen to be at the Cosmopolitan. It will set you back about $10.00 for two slices of pepperoni pizza, and they have a water cooler, so no need to buy a soda. Also it is an interesting place to people watch. Both the clientele and staff offer free entertainment. Enjoy!
This place has ruined me for any other pizza. It was amazing!  Will stop everytime I'm in Vegas.
Great simple pizza.  Love the meatlovers.  The price is right and the atmosphere is simple and inviting. Check it out.....if you can find it
Has a New York style and great cheesy taste. Pepperoni was spicey. Mom liked the mushroom pizza.  On the pricey side.

Definitely not a secret... once we figured out where the 3rd floor was ... the long line and scent of pizza made it easy to locate. Pretty quick service, only thing that bothered me was when I went to fold it in half to stuff in my face the tip kept falling into itself. No biggie though. Fresh tasting. .. sausage had good flavor so did the crust and sauce.
Got to deduct at least one star. While you have great pizza with a perfect crust; I requested some salt and pepper and was told "sorry we don't have any"

The crust was amazing.

I hesitate to call it NYC pizza, because the majority of NYC pizza I've had is crap compared to this.

get the white pizza - mozzarella cheese, feta, and garlic (no red sauce).  totally yum. all their pies have a thin, new york crust and you can easily (easily) eat three. i'd pretty much eat any of the pizza there.  It's a a great little spot that i love to stop by if i've had a couple of drinks, and even when i haven't.  get a whole pie because you might as well.  a whole pie is a little over $20, while a slice is about $3

Will, Hector make a great pizza. Nice casual environment to enjoy a $5 pizza.  Buried on third floor of the Cosmo hotel surrounded by $$$ restaurant.  A definite "gotta go" for a excellent slice of real NY pizza
The best pizza in town and great beer. Defiantly a must have when in Las Vegas.

Great pizza, and super cheap. Just like New York. It's on the 3rd floor just straight and to the left once you get off the escalator and down the vinyl cover decorated hallway like other reviewers stated. We talked to the guys there about the myths that they import their water from Brooklyn and their Italian flour from Italy. They said, "no, it's just really good pizza with regular water and ingredients."

Probably the best New York style pizza on the strip.

I was surprised that so many good reviews for this pizza. So I went to find it, it's really hard to find it by yourself since it isn't on the list near the escalator. Better to ask the persons working there. 

The place is small and simple, very different from the environment. I cared about the environment of the restaurant a lot! This place is not a good place, I have to say.

But the taste is good, I think. If u want to have a meal fast, it would be ur option.

Although the pizza might be good, the lines at 2am are nuts and last forever. It's only pizza, hard to think you'll spend over an hour in this line.


Good food, just need to serve customers faster.

The wait was about 30 minutes for this place on a Saturday night, considering that awesome late night urge to consume pizza after copious amounts of drinking and debauchery.

My friends and I waited in line, and they managed to order their pizzas. I was behind them, and the guy taking orders/making pizza looked me over and went on to the next person. I figured I'd have my order taken at the cashier, but no dice. When I got to the cashier, she asked me what I'd ordered, and when I told her nothing yet, she looked to the pizza guy. Dude had the gall to say I'd cut in line? Maybe he missed the fact that a friend of mine ahead of me handed me a water bottle as they were paying for their order. Not sure what his deal was, but my business is better spent elsewhere. Took them about an hour to make the pizzas, too- way too long for anyone impatiently waiting to get their grub on. I'm sure they'll make their money off of other customers coming back from clubs drunk.

PS The pizza's mediocre, but insobriety makes everything better, doesn't it? Not worth the buck.

Pizza was yummy... 

I had the White Pizza which I really enjoyed!!  It had a garlicky taste and no red sauce!
My daughter had a silce of Cheese Pizza.  She said it was crispy and cheesy.

Their drinks are expensive but served in a Red Solo Cup!!

Like many humans, I love pizza. But this place. I'm ready to have a love affair with this pizza. The rigatoni, mozzarella, and garlic pizza was so delicious and foldable, and grease was literally dripping down my arm. 
What a fun place! It really is a hole in the wall. You go to the third floor and then just go straight down the sketchy hallway.

Traveling down a hallway between two fancy restaurants at Cosmopolitan, who would've known that a simple little pizzeria existed.  The pizza was perfect with a light crisp and the perfect amount of drizzly cheese.  The folks at Pizzeria were welcoming and genuinely happy to see you.  I loved that!

The best pizza you can find after a night of drinking! Although this place is always packed, the line typically moves quickly and you'll have your food in less than 15 minutes. Prices are "Vegas moderate" expect about $20-ish for two slices and two sodas. Always a must have for each of my Vegas trips!

It was quite a wait for this pizza as we ordered two whole pies, but I gotta say it was worth it.  Maybe I had been drinking too much, and maybe I was too hungry, but the pizza really hit the spot.  The piemakers and cashier were really good about keeping the customers at bay, considering the time that it was taking to get their orders.  We ordered a standard sausage/pepperoni and the white pizza with ricotta, thin crust and cooked just right.  Copiously sprinkled with crushed pepper and you are good to go for an evening out on the town...until you come back for another round in a drunken bout of hunger.  In which case we did at another late night pizza place that didn't quite hit the mark as Secret Pizza did.

I wasn't impressed.

During the start of a girls weekend in Vegas, we set our sights on Secret Pizza early on.  Once we "found it" (super easy to find), we walked down the album covered hallway to discover minimal seating and zero ambiance.  The pizza is about as good as an average NY pizzeria (which is to say, it's better than most places =P), so if you're looking for a slice of home, that is what you'll get.  Nothing too special, definitely solid, but this stop was definitely made for post Marquee fuel.  If you want better pizza spot with more ambiance, head over to the Aria and hit up Five50.
great nyc pizza!!! check it out!!!
Pizza was good but a bit on the oily side. Expensive for what it is, don't see what the hype is all about.
Wonderful secret hidden pizza place! Line is always really long but worth the wait! The pizza is extra large and yummy! Recommend especially after concerts at the Chelsea!

solid pizza
GREAT crust/dough.. slightly chewy with a nice, light crunch
good flavor but a way too oily

kind of expensive

This pizza is gooooood. So... what do we do when something is goooood? We go twice in 24 hours.  During our first visit to Secret Pizza at 11am on a Saturday morning, there was no line and no wait. Piping hot pizza served to you right away. We grab a seat at the clean and sparkly counter and all is right with the world.

Our second time visiting secret pizza, we head up to the third floor at around 1am. We encounter several people in the elevators all vying for the same pep slice. Some friendly conversation ensues, and suddenly without further discourse, folks start stretching out their legs, warming up pushing their way towards the elevator door. As soon as this door opens in the elevator, I kid you not,  there is a mad dash to the "secret" hallway. This would have been epic, however, we are all  stopped in our tracks because there is a line of about 30 people ahead of us. Womp. Womp. The line moved pretty fast. It took about 15 minutes to get our slices. However, the state of the little pizzeria was quite different from our 11am visit. At this point in the night, the counters are littered with pizza crusts, empty drink cups and used napkins soaked in pizza grease. The red pepper and garlic shakers are empty and the woman ringing up your pizza, will tell you "No" before you're even done with your question (the lady ahead tried to ask for ranch dipping sauce for her crust). The pizza was just as good though.
Secret pizza is the perfect spot to come after hitting up marquee and a long night of drinking. Their pizza always hits the spot!!
Located in Cosmo on 3rd floor next to the elevator. If ur feeling like a casual pizza...this is ur spot! Tried the veggie slice and deep dish white

We'd heard about this ultra cool, secret pizza joint in The Cosmo about a month before we stayed there. When we checked in we asked about it and decided that was going to be our first meal of the trip. We found it and walked in, saw the pizza and it was over. I ordered the white pizza and my husband ordered pepperoni and meatball. Both were nothing short of awesome. I preferred the white, it was so simple but some of the best I've ever had. We went back 2 more times during our stay and each time the service and pizza were great. Perfect place to grab a quick slice before or after a night out...or anytime, for that matter. A MUST DO, when in Vegas.
Idk I was still hungry after one slice. But it's got a good taste and its super greasy and cheesy.
Great little hole in the wall pizza joint on level 3 of the Cosmopolitan.  New York style pizza was great and affordable compared to all the expensive restaurants.    Will definitely visit again!

After a long night flight from the East Coast I was ready for a quick bit before bed. We decided to give this place a try, i have to say I almost walked out because of the long line and no where to sit... but the hunger overcame me!!  So the line went by quick, the pizza slices are made to order!! Finally I don't have to share with my husband, we both get what we want!!  Thank goodness I didn't walk out, this was delish!!
Hope to stay at City Center again, so I can have some yummy pizza
Pizza is really as good as it gets in Vegas.  However it is really pricey.  $5.00 a slice and $25.00 for a large cheese is the most expensive pizza I've ever seen.

Had the white pizza slice...it was delicious! The staff was nice and welcoming. There's not a lot of seating--so be prepared to grab it to-go and eat it elsewhere. This was the most inexpensive place i've eaten on the strip and it doesn't disappoint!

One food stop that never disapoints! Where ever I stay in Vegas I always hit up the Secret Pizza spot in Cosmo.  It's worth finding if you like giant slices of amazing pizza. Nothing fancy about the dinning area, the focus is all on some of the best pizza you'll ever have.  The last couple times I went there was a pinball machine that's fun to play when it's not busy. It satisifies that urge a quick snack without dropping a ton on a fancy resturant. 
I highly recommend this place to everyone.

Prices went up.  Still a good deal on the Strip, but not a super good deal.  This makes me sad :(

Oh, and the pizza is still yumtastic.

Frickin awesome!!!! I love secret pizza! I totally wanna open up a place like this in Hawaii!  No frills just great pizza and great service!  Definitely hitting up this place next time I call in sick!
The pizza tasted really well. The toppings were fresh, and the sauce, cheese, and crust went together well. I didn't like seeing the guy handle money, and then food without washing his hands. Gross.
This place is amazing. And I've eaten a lot of different pizzas. NY style done right. The next time I'm in Vegas, I know where I'm headed.

I had the white pizza, which was delicious and lived up to the hype. The guy at the cash register was nice. I also liked that they serve Coke Zero in addition to Diet Coke, but it was $3.25 for a red cup of average soda. That's the most expensive soda I've ever had, even comparing to at restaurants with tables or bars. There are a few stools and a TV inside, and I was able to sit there to eat my pizza since there weren't many people around. I'd definitely come back if I return to Vegas.

This is by far my favorite place for a white pizza .... Outside of New York of course. 

Pro: if you're staying in the hotel you can skip the line and order from room service. Same pizza without the line.

Con: No ranch unless you order room service.

This place is another great after the club spot. You can easily walk pass this place and not even know that there is a pizza joint in the back. We stood in line for about 30-45 minutes. I personally thought the wait is too long which is why its getting minus 1 star. However, when I got the pizza, OMG it was delicious! They had a decent variety to choose from and each sliced pizza is heated to order. Prices were fair but no seating---booooo! Would I go here again, yes but only if the line was shorter.

I've never paid more than $1.50 for what I considered to be delicious pepperoni pizza (which is at costco) but Secret Pizza was recommendation from a friend for a quick lunch since I didn't want to eat fast food. This place does live up to its name since I had to ask two Cosmo employees to point me to the direction of this place; no signs or the name is not on the directory. The place is small and there is counter space for people to quickly eat their pizza but if you want to have conversation I would recommended just heading out right outside where there are couches and pool table to eat and enjoy your meal.

Now onto the food, I first ordered the sausage and pepperoni and within the first bite I was hooked! What makes this great pizza is their crust, it has just right amount of texture between doughy and crunchy. Because of this I've been back 3 times within my 3-day in Vegas needless to say I'll be back!

Cool little place on the third floor of the Cosmopolitan. Not labeled, if you're not looking for it you'd walk right by it. (Hence the secret).

Tried the white pizza, it wasn't good or bad (Not a big fan of white pizza but went for it). I could see how someone that likes white pizza would enjoy it. I also tried the pepperoni, it was good, but not great. 

For two slices (fairly big) and a 20oz bottle of smart water my total was $15. Rather cheap for food on the strip but not a great deal in general considering most pizzas are $15.

It really is a secret. Not even on the directory we went up and down until we found it. 3rd floor baby. Be prepared to wait in a cramped space with rowdy hungry drunk people but once you bite into that piece of heaven.. No pizza will ever be the same. Tip--eat it right there or on the couches outside. That's right have no shame. We had a slice there and took the rest back to our room and by then it lost its oomph. There isn't really a place to sit (counters to eat on) and it gets super crowded in there so order ahead. Good luck on having someone answer the phone. I called only 10 times to try to order ahead.

Im a carb girl.  Ordered the pepperoni and pepperoncini pizza & white pizza.. Hey, I was on vacation! The pepperoni and pepperoncini was sooo good. It was rich and almost had a buttery quality about it. The best part was the dough/bread.. It was buttery, crisp, sweet and drool-worthy.

A must place to eat when at the Cosmo. My wife and I ate there twice during our stay. The line can be long depending on time you go. We waited about 15 minutes at around 2PM and around 40 minutes at midnight.  My wife had a slice with mushrooms and I tried the white pizza with ricotta and garlic and a slice with meatball and ricotta.  Great pizza at a reasonable price (about $5/slice plus extra for toppings).  Also got a slice of cheesecake since also wanted something sweet - it was a large piece for about $4.50 but was just OK.  Will definitely go again our next stay.
Worth the hunt! Very good pizza & a nice alternative to the high price restaurants everywhere else.

My guy and I try and make it a point to stop by Secret Pizza every time we visit Las Vegas. I can't say I'm a huge pizza connoisseur, but I have tried pizza from a lot of places in my life (most of them turn out to be just OK). And I have to say, this may be the best pizza I've ever had.

A must go to, when in Las Vegas. The pizza is always phenomenal! Don't let the long line deter from the deliciousness awaiting. Located in the Cosmopolitan hotel, I tell all my friends about this place.
So amazing, definitely a good late night spot. Born and raised on NY pizza and this is as good as it gets to compare.
Great crust, but pretty greasy and on the expensive side.  Just a few stools for seating. Kind of cool location and atmosphere.

This place is great! It took me longer to find it than it did to eat! Great NY style thin crust w cold beer in a red plastic cup. One small TV , but in an age of over indulgence, it was refreshing. It's a must stop to any stay in the strip.
One of the best pizzas I had in a long time. Some of the hotel staff had no idea where it was located but thanks to other Yelp reviews we were able to find it.

Great place, worth searching. Don't expect the best pizza of your life. Expect amusement, great quality of pizza to go, but, unfortunately, inequal ratio price / quality die to the position and guerilla marketing around it.

Loved the white pizza for a quick lunch but 5.50 for a slice is pretty high. However, the flavors were spot on with just the right amount of garlic and creamy ricotta. The crust is fairly thin with a chewy consistency that requires a good bite down and watch the stringy cheese pull away. Definitely fulfills that NYC style pizza crazing.

Amazing, authentic and fun!  Great job we will be back!!!!!  It's definitely NY pizza... If you have never had a NY Za and are used to vegas pizza places then you might not get it.  The crust is perfect and so is everything about the toppings and the little white tiled place. Defiantly worth the drive and the money.

There's no sign out side so you need to know where it is. Near the Marquee nightclub, it saved us from many hungry nights. There's times where the lines were so long that we had to walk out but what can you do. Nice lounge areas outside that I can go to do eat with my group of friends. Not sure if you can call ahead of time but if I can order in advance, that'd be great.

Secret Pizza it is! All I know is I see tons of people sitting around the middle of a casino with labeless pizza boxes at 2am.  After a very brief attempt, my friends and I finally asked and was directed to this random hall that led to the tiny secret pizza place.  You can buy by the slice or whole pie.  They run efficiently and take your order fast but expect a short line and wait as they reheat your pizza in the oven as it has gotten cold sitting out in display.  They have about 4 kinds of pizza, all NY style so very thin crust and slice but very delicious.  A little high price for pizza in general, but practically free by Vegas restaurant means.

FYI, there are about 5 bar stools and no where else to sit.  It is a true pizza joint, buy your pie and get out.

I only eat pizza in two scenarios: When I'm in NYC and when I'm in Vegas--at Secret Pizza. This is LEGIT NY style pizza and it's absolutely amazing. I almost don't want to tell anyone else about it because it's so secret :). If you can find it, eat it. That's all there is to it.

Great value and absolutely delicious pizza! This unmarked hole in the wall on the third floor of Cosmo hotel next to Blue Ribbon Sushi is one of the best kept secrets on the strip. I couldn't get enough!
Great pizza and excellent service. I love secret things and I love pizza so you can imagine I'll cross the street for such things! Yummy.

Got off of the plane, found my friend (a local), claimed my luggage, and then were off to Secret Pizza for lunch!  Hidden away on the 3rd floor of the Cosmopolitan, completely unmarked, down a long photo covered hallway, Secret Pizza is a heavenly find.  Here, you can buy full pizzas or slices.  Since we were just having lunch, my friend and I both ordered slices and a soda.  Choosing from the options on hand, I got two slices of meatball and ricotta.  They were AMAZING!  Thin, perfectly crispy crust, with ample portions of sliced meatball and ricotta blotches, and just the right amount of sauce in between.  Make your selection and the guy behind the counter cuts your slice and places it in the oven to reheat and crisp up, giving you a beautifully hot, melty slice of pizza goodness!

Salty, boring and pricey pizza. Guess all the great reviews are from all the drunks who come out of the club late at night and think they remember the pizza was the best they ever had. Two stars cause the guys making the pizza were really nice.

Pizza was great (had the Margherita)!  The calamari was EXCELLENT!!!!!  Best calamari EVER!  Everytime I go to vegas I am getting the calamari!  EVERYTIME!!  

The only thing I hated was the seating arrangement.  I like a place with a lot of booths.

Service was great and drinks were nice and strong ;)
Sometimes you just want a big slice of pizza and sometimes it can't be kept a secret.

I've gone here maybe 3 times now. I love the pizza! Especially the sausage and pepperoni! The cheese pizza is also very good. 
I like to buy a whole pie and have it for breakfast too! It's even better the next day. A whole pie can easily feed 4-5 people. I know this because 5 dudes from New York came in and ate the whole thing! Yes, it totally reminded them of pizzerias from their home town of NYC! That says a lot! 
Yeah, you can have the high end stuff outside of this place, but the satisfaction will be the same and the pizza will be cheaper! You'll love it! Trust me! If they added more seating, 5 stars easy!

The pizza was great. I ordered 2 slices of regular pizza, they are amazing, the crust are thin and there are a lot topping. Highly recommend this place. It's hard to find the place because its not listed on the directory, it's located on the 3rd floor in the Cosmopolitan Hotel, next to Blue Ribbon.

Lovely fresh pizza slices and not too expensive. Nice little entrance/hallway with a wicked pinball machine and a Galaga arcade machine there too.

I have, however, marked it down a star. This is because it's a pain in the balls to find one you've had (quite) a few drinks, and it was a hell of a walk back to wherever the hell it was I came from when I thought that pizza, from an almost unfindable location, when my brain and all other faculties were almost fatally crippled through the liberal application of tequila, was a good idea.

The staff there are great too.

I love, love, LOVE this pizza! I'm always up to try new places where they serve pizza! It was 3 am and I was craving pizza, so we went across the street to go get some. Let me tell you, this pizza is amazing. I definitely will keep going whenever I'm in Vegas.

This might be the best pizza I've ever had.

The prices are extremely reasonable for Las Vegas and the staff is really friendly.  I've had their cheese pizza, meat lovers pizza (HIGHLY recommend), and a slice of ricotta & meatball.  They have beer on tap (simply: PBR or IPA).  They have video games.  It has become a staple of any Vegas visit for me.
It is hard to find but it is definitely worth it!  You can either pick up a pizza or just get a slice immediately.  They are open late and it is great to get a slice after going out at night.

Over-rated.  Guy making them got OJT about how to make pizza.
Ingredients are said to be made fresh daily from a couple of NYC
guys but it was over-priced and over-hyped for what it its.
Settobello better.
I love secret places...and the pizza was delicious! The staff was friendly and attentive!! I'll be in for a slice every time I'm here!!

Excellent. Love the Where's Waldo aspect of finding this place. Around one am we waited in line for about a half hour-not bad at all!! The pizza was excellent. Love the experience. The crust is amazing. The pepperoni is pretty spicy, fyi. If I went back j would just get the cheese pizza as the pepperoni made my lips burn lol. But if you like spicy it's very good.
The pizza was delicious and it the line moved quickly. There is minimal room to sit so plan on taking it out to the couch area or elsewhere but it is definitely worth it.

I wish that who ever told me about 'Secret Pizza', kept it a secret!

4.50 for a regular slice of greasy limp under cooked tasteless pie and no tables eat it? Skip on this secret for sure!

'Secret Pizza' rates with any 'run of the mill' joints on the strip.
Skip the Secret and head to MetroPizza, Grimaldi's, or 'DeFara West' Dom Demarco's when is Vegas!

I don't know how much longer this place can be a "secret" because it is seriously good! We came here one late night from a friend's recommendation, whom we thought was trolling us the entire time, but it turned out that this place exists! The place was pretty packed. We waited for about 45 minutes to get our three whole pizza orders. They were sooooo worth the wait! They were NYC style pizza (we tried the Chicago one too but it wasn't that good). The slices were big and the cheese was oozing out of the pizza with every bite. It might be because we were hungry too but everyone in my group thought the pizzas were excellent! We'll definitely be back here on our next trip to Vegas!
Must go, awesome pizza...if you can find it lol!  All the pizzas were awesome.  We go here every time we are in Las Vegas.  Ask the employees at the cosmopolitan where it is at!

Secret Pizza Kitchen is no damn joke! The pizza here is honestly one of the (if not the best) pizza I have every tried.

Its is really not that tough to find if you ask around. They were out of the white pizza which I really wanted to try. Would not be ready for 20 minutes and I am not a patient person when it comes to food.

Wife and I ordered 2 slices each which came out to $5 a slice. We had the plain peperroni and chesse, and the mushroom with sausage pizza. Haaaaaaleluya....Haaaaaaaleluya! Yeah that is what I heard in the background as I took my first bites. Seriously excellent tasting. I even finished the crust which Is something I never do.

Pricey? Yes. Worth it. YES! A large pie will run you about $20.

The only reason I deducted a star is because there is no seating available, which would be cool if they did. I personally don't like to eat standing up.

But in all seriousness, there is no way I will do this place justice by describing the taste. You have to come and try for yourself asap!

P.S. No I was not drunk
Great  tasting pizza after a long walk along the strip! It's cheap, it's filling and it's tasty. Screw fine dining!!
hehe. Saved me many drunk nights at the cosmepolitan. Has a nice lounge outside to eat and hang out while shooting pool. Oh yeah, pizza is delish

Oh ayyy, ayyy oh!! Oh, Marone a mi, fuhgetaboutit, this place is fanfreakintastic!! 

Lol, I almost wish nobody knew about this place. This is definitely a secret worth keeping. It deserves every one of the 5 stars I have given it! I mean the pies are pretty damn good, but it just goes beyond that with everything else. 

From the moment you walk in & are greeted by my Paisan, Nico until you leave, you just can't help but feel giddy. When you step up to the counter, Nico just lays it all out, as only he can, starting you off with the pricing & some playful banter & all the different magic you can make with your slice or pie. The magic is definitely limited to your own imagination ;) 

However, I went with the basics, a slice of cheese & a slice of pepperoni & washed it down with a Barq's. My date du jour had a slice of cheese & some water. At which time, we took our place on some stools along the counter & did the good old pizza fold & chowed down! 

We strolled in about 2 am-ish, after catching a movie at Rave. I was totally craving a slice! It wasn't too busy at all, fortunately ;) It looked like there had just been a crowd in there, as it was a little messy. But that only adds to the charm of such a place. 

The most magical part of this late night pizza craving was, that it was all "on them"! Unfortunately for us, or them, depending on how you look at it, they couldn't take cards at that particular time, which was all I had on me. So yeah, SCORE! Cuz, I do likes me some FREE eats ;) However, we did leave a nice tip for them in the tip jar. 

Overall, an awesome place to grab a slice or a whole pie. Definitely a cool vibe & not something you would expect to be in a stunning place, such as the Cosmo. You gotta really look for this place when you get up to the 3rd floor. Which is all I'm saying :P You will have to read the other reviews on here to find your way. Lol!

Secret pizza is in a really hidden  no sign you barely see the entrance. Pizza it's self isn't that bad I prefer white pizza, supreme and pepperoni is kinda salty. 
Big tip: if you going with a group better call them and order otherwise you would  overpay for slices also when you try to reach them they don't pick up a phone so you definitely should wait until some one will answer the phone. Line after Marquee hours is getting insane so be aware of that but overall pretty tasty pizza when u really hungry!!!

Staying at the Cosmopolitan and this restaurant was recommended to me by my sister-n-law who frequents here and described it as a really cool "secret" pizza place and that I had to know what I wanted before I got to the counter. I arrived around 3 pm after spotting someone coming out of the "hole" with a pizza box. The short hallway is lined with record covers. The menu had 3 choices but there were more options on the counter. The staff was friendly and did not rush me. I chose the pepperoni mushroom which was reheated for me and I stood at a counter height table to eat it. The pizza was good, not great but it hit the spot since I was starving! It had thin crust and minimal sauce. When I folded it to eat it, grease dripped out, but hey-who's complaining?!? It's pizza!! Recommend to anyone who'd like to have a unique experience while in Vegas!
Luv this place!! Its like walking in off the streets of NYC. & the fact that you have to know where it is to fnd it is the best!
Great pizza, a little pricey, great service a definite place to stop and try for a quick bite .

Dammmmm GOOD!
Cons: strip prices, 7 chairs-grab one or stand up eating
Pros: crust, in the cool cosmopolitan , drink refills,

So taking our son to game works we decided to park @ Cosmo & eat-was $100 for wicked spoon buffet for 2 adults & child- so saved that for another time & had read about this spot on yelp-
Tiny hole in the wall-literally
Get it by the slice or order whole pie
Was 30+ min wait for whole pie so we ordered 6 slices + salad+ bottle of water + 1 coke=55$ish 
Like I said your on the strip so to be expected. Anyway..
Omg amazing crust on white pie- I can still taste it - ordered w sliced meatballs SOOO GOOD.
Bf & son had pep & mushroom they loved it & after "ciao ciao apizza " closed its been a hard sell for them to find decent pizza
The spot right outside is so chill w a pool table - great for a date or chill w friends

Read a lot of good reviews about this place so we decided to go on a hunt and find it. Its definitely in a hidden area. The pizza is pretty good, the staff isn't super friendly but I would definitely go back when in the area to have another slice.
So glad we found it.  Great crust and toppings.  I never eat the crust but ate every last bite.  Only recommendation is maybe add a little more sauce.  Will come back whenever we are in Vegas.  Yum!
Had the white pizza wife had the cheese no doubt one of the best in town

Pizza was decent.. Not exactly mind blowing but a good snack if you're drunk.

The success of secret pizza is its mystery factor.  A neat idea,  but the average pizza means this is just a one time visit for me.

White pizza was incredible.  The place was fun to find..ok we did have to ask and where" 25 steps away " the slices are pretty large and we didnt need to order 2 slices each..but it was so good we ate it all

Great pizza, the line wasn't too long and the beer is actually affordable.  For on the strip dining it's excellent considering the price.  Customer service was meh but they are busy and deal with a lot of idiots so I get it.  Also it was easy to find follow the drunk frat guys in swim trunks.

What are are the 5 star reviews for. The pizza was terrible. Very Greasy and expensive. 2 things. 1st they get great ratings due to the fact that the kids review the place on the spot when the are drunk and think its the best pizza. Also I think it maybe was good when it 1st came out but they started to go cheap on things. 
Also why do you guys reheat the pizza after ordering it. There was a line out the door. keep the pizza it a hot display case or something so you can serve it faster and not have to toss it in the oven.
downtown pizza is still my favorite.

Located on the 3rd floor of the Cosmopolitan Hotel and across the escalator through a long hallway you'll find one of the best pizzas in Las Vegas. We ordered the white pizza special with pepperoni and some sort of sausage and a mushroom and sausage pizza. Both were delicious! Total came out to $11 for the two pizzas. You can also use your Cosmopolitan Identity Players card to pay for your meal if you have enough points. There isn't really much space to eat inside but you can take your meal outside by the escalator where there is a nice lounge area with plenty of seating. You will find many people devouring their pizzas there! There is also a pool table you can use for free. We will be coming back here again!

Grabbed a pizza here before we went clubbing at marquee when we stayed at the cosmopolitan. The pizza was a little pricey but being in the cosmopolitan it wasn't too bad for a whole pizza at $32 in my opinion, especially since it was pretty big and had I think 5 toppings on it

The pizza tasted great and all the toppings mixed well and it had a lot of cheese which was nice as I hate it when my pizza doesn't have enough cheese. My only complaint is that the pizza is thin crust here and I am not a very big fan of thin crust pizza. But I was still very happy with it as it tasted great, hit the spot, and put a little something in my belly before a night of drinking and raging at marquee

Great slice, good price, very friendly crew. Small seating area and not hard to find if you know where to look!

Classic NY style thin crust pizza.
Delicious pizza! What better place to go when you're hungry at 2 am? The line can get a bit long, but it's worth the wait.
Pizza was so good, it took me back to my childhood. Crispy crust and very good melts cheese. Definitely one of the best pizza I've had.

Simple and a bit overpriced, but so delicious. Perfect late night snack but there will be a long wait (which isn't so great when you've been in heels all night). There is a very small counter with a few stools, but luckily we were able to find some seats near the pool table right outside the entrance.

Amazing!  I love how you feel like you've found a hidden gem, not to mention the best pizza I've had.  We both had two pieces: cheese, mozzarella, veggie, and mushroom...all were great, but the cheese is my favorite.  They have the perfect amount of cheese sauce and the thin crust is phenomenal!  Not a lot of seating, but lucky for us we went for an early dinner (around 6:30pm) on a Saturday night so we sat next to the pinball machine.
Found this place on yelp, awesome! We were the only guys there, cheap pizza, cheap drinks, great music. No complaints!

I'm a huge pizza snob and this place is amazing. I had the both the veggie and pepperoni and peppers slices and my only regret was not having the entire rest of the pie to go with them. Totally worth the long line. If you're looking for authentic NY pizza, this stuff is the real deal.

Our go to pizza joint late at night.  Been coming here for the last couple years whenever we get a late night craving. Depending on the time the wait can be short or really long.  We ordered ahead of time so picking up our pizzas was a breeze.  Something about the dough/crust that makes their pizza taste so good! Thanks again secret pizza!
The pizza is ridiculously good! It's on the 3 floor and it took a long time to find it. It was fun and worth the hunt!! Whole pie that is huge $30 for one topping! Individual slices sold too!

Great slice of pie. The staff was really friendly even with all the alcohol infused patrons. Grabbed a slice of pepperoni and a pepperoni with meatballs. I hope this joint is there the next time I visit Vegas.

This pizza was amazing. 
I ordered it for room service last year when I was on a trip and didn't realize it was such a big deal. 

The pizza tastes great. It's even more exciting because it's a "secret". Must try!
Awful pizza. Comparable to Sbarro's. Save yourself the time, money, and calories and go somewhere good.
Well worth the $5. The slices are HUGE!! Limited seating but if you come at lunch time it's pretty quiet anyways. Highly recommend the white pizza. Won't disappoint.
Ny style pizza. Tasted like joes pizza. Expensive slices compared to back in NY. Soda in ghetto solo cups.

FOOD =GREAT

STAFF= Friendly / new Yorker vibe

PRICE= Good for Vegas casino 


Great secret spot for delicious pizza.
Staff is great & pizza might be close to the best in Vegas! Get there before a line starts forming this place gets packed quick. Definitely check this place out while you are in Vegas.

Came here late on a Sunday night with two of my friends. I got 2 slices - 1 vegetable, and the other meatball and goat cheese for $12. Both slices were delicious however a little disappointing because they weren't heated up very well so the experience was a little lackluster.
Pretty solid pizza joint, ny style, big slices, a bit pricey as my slice of pepperoni was $5. Located on third floor beside sushi rest. Worth a trip tho.
Great pizza!  If you like New York style you'll love this. Any variation is delicious. Amazing crust and good sauce....2 things that matter most to me!  Oh I guess 3 things CHEESE rocks too.

Stopped in here mid-day during our trip, and the place was nearly empty, so the service was quick. I ordered a slice of white pizza and my BF got a slice of pepperoni. His was nice and hot, but mine was a little on the lukewarm side. Still, it was really good: lots of garlic and cheese. Definitely hit the spot, and given my slightly buzzed state, worth the $5/slice.

Born and bred in NYC! ok....not really, lived there for about 5 years, but hey, one thing I did gain was a decent level of pizza knowledge, and one thing I can say is this place does NYC pizza. Soooo good, went there both nights we were there. Late night joint, definitely a lot of the nightlife crowd filling this place up, but I will say, the pizza with the italian sausage was sooooo good. Highly recommend, Secret pizza, not so SECRET anymore, especially when you see a line coming out of a small hallway

3 stars: A-OK.

It's kind of the worst kept secret in town. 

Prices aren't exactly cheap, but it is in the Cosmopolitan and rent can't be cheap.

It's one of those places where they charge what they charge because they can. Like when you go to Disneyland and a bottle of water is $6 bucks. If you're desperate enough, you'll pay the $6 and be happy about it. 

Consider it a convenience tax.

They have nice pepperoni and they have a bianca with ricotta, which is kind of a dying breed these days.

It's good to have this spot in your back pocket if you're on the strip and dying for hot food and you've only got a hamilton in your pocket and lost all your credit cards. 

It's not destination pizza. You don't make plans to come here specifically to eat the pizza. You eat the pizza here because you can.

I love this place on a late night ! It's perfect for that after club snack lol 
Ya May have to ask, it is a bit hidden........

If little ceasars is 0 and rays pizza of ny is 10 this place gets a 7.  Granted i got a wild hair to push me to this place at midnight on a friday night just after the marquee let out. Got there at midnight, is about 12:20 when I placed my order and about 1:00am when i walked out with it.  Two stools to sit at with easilly 100 people in line, sports on TV, crowded with others waiting on orders. Ordered cheese pizza for $26 which is pretty steep but considering the location I wasnt suprised.  The pizza was good but nothing to write home about.  I know they were rushed and I probably couldve had a better experience when they werent as busy but I also know I can go to leftys or verrazanos and get better pizza for half the price but nit at 1am
Awesome pizza joint. If you're going to get 3 or more slice just buy a whole pizza. Cheap large & tasty food for vegas prices. I will come again. Maybe tomorrow morning and the next lol

With a four-and-a-half star rating, I was excited to try this place out.

Man, I wish I had saved my $25. 

The guy behind the counter prepping the pizzas was nice enough - explained how things worked without a condescending tone.  The girl helping out new to the operation, so there was a bit of a learning curve on keeping things going.  No problem; I've been in the same situation.    However, once the pizza went into the oven for re-heating and the money was in the register, that about ended an otherwise okay experience.

I swear it took like 20 minutes to get our 3 slices.  3 SLICES.  Another guy took over the pizza-making duties and made it his priority to only check up on the full pizza orders.  So when our slices finally came out, they were burnt at the crusts and essentially crackers at the base.  I told my fiance that I was not eating my ONE slice, he had to bring it back and ask for another slice (I told him to take his back too, but he was too nice to do so).  Another slice of margherita pizza that had been sitting there for quite some time that they could just throw into the oven for reheating.  I was really disappointed that they even gave us the pizza burnt - who serves burned pizza?!  That's already been cooked once?

We should've just gone down to Fashion Show Mall and had a few slices at Sbarro for a fraction of the price.  I guess if you want average pizza in a pretentious setting masquerading as hole-in-the-wall (literally) joint, this could be heaven.

Next time I'll check out their burger joint or that Chinese/Mexican food fusion place down the way.

Yummmm!  The Cosmo is our favorite hotel in Vegas...  Has the best pizza...  The best Tapa's restaurant...  The best concert venue...  

We love the white pizza and sausage with ricotta but even the plain cheese is excellent. 

I won't lie...  It's a bit pricey but worth it!

It's a must every time we go Vegas!!

Wish there was one in So. Cal!!

One of the best slices of pizza I've ever tried.  There's places that do certain parts of a pizza  well, but I really liked just about everything about this place.  Cool setting and atmosphere, friendly staff, and most importantly, good pizza.  I tried a slice of the white pizza and one of the supremes.  The white pizza was a perfect blend of different cheeses, garlic, and a fantastic crust.  Almost cracker like on the outside, yet moist and chewy on the inside.  While I also enjoyed the supreme, it seemed to be lacking something....hard to pin point it.  Overall, they pretty much nailed it though.

I need to make one thing absolutely clear when starting this review: this is NOT by any means 'NY style pizza.' If you think that, you obviously have either never been to NY, or were unfortunate enough to eat at one of the bad pizza spots. The positive reviews for this place must come from people who were completely obliterated when they ate here; that is the only way I can imagine anyone believing this to be good pizza. I came here with my husband after having a few drinks recently because Holstein's, our first choice, was closed. After waiting in line for 30 mins, we finally got our two slices. He ordered pepperoni and I had a regular slice; both were the most bland, dry, unappetizing pizza I have ever tried. There was next to no sauce on the pizza, and it tasted as if it had been under a heating lamp all day. Being that the place was extremely busy, the pizza coming out should not taste this way. Coming from NYC, I admit I have high expectations for pizza, but I've tasted better frozen pizza from Walmart. Not only did we have to stand in line for so long to get this disgusting food, but we had to eat our food standing against a wall because the place is so tiny.
