I would never waste my time, money, or the calories on this pizza again.

Possibly the best meatball pizza here in Vegas, I would go back just for another slice of it.  Not horrible price wise, but it's not dirt cheap either.  I had a slice of meat lovers pizza and a slice of the mushroom pizza (meh) and a root beer for $11.75, so you can ballpark it from there.  It's awesome quality pizza, with a thin yet crispy crust that actually holds up pretty well.  It's really standing room at counters only, but you can find a few stools to sit on, and it's cool that they have an old school pinball machine and an old video game machine too.

This pizza rocks in my opinion. I know, everyone has their own idea of good pizza and of NYC pizza and of thin-crust pizza etc... but it brings me right back to NYC everytime with the perfect ratio of crispy crust and oregano and garlic in the sauce. Its not the most convenient place when you just want a slice but I usually pick up a piece everytime I'm on the strip. Their homemade ricotta is to die for, and that's coming from someone who is not a cheese fan...

Pizza and cannoli--good, greasy pizza and perfectly sweet cannoli with a nice creamy filling. We had to search for this place...it's on the third floor down a hallway lined with old records. It's pretty no-nonsense and cheap in comparison to pretty much everything else nearby. I could tell the ingredients are high-quality as well--there were heirloom tomatoes in my salad and the dressing tasted homemade. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

Having missed this place during my last visit, my mind was incepted with the idea of coming here later in the night....fast forward to 2am and my buddies and I are waiting in line for our post party meal of cheese, meats, and GREASE! Tucked next to Jaleo on the 2nd floor of the Cosmo, it's really not that hard to find, unless, I guess if you are super drunk. But there was a pretty decent line for this Secret pizza place, reminds me of the lines at the jumbo slice places back here in DC after a night of partying, but no one really minded the wait with the main prizes on their mind and taste buds.

The pizza itself? I thought it was great, I mean I blinked and it was gone. Maybe it was the fact that I was starving and had a few drinks, but I remember it having a distinct taste, nice and soft, not too soft or floppy, freshly baked dough and crusts and a good helping of toppings on each slice. I got two slices; one white pizza with cheese and ricotta cheese and a second slice with mushroom and pepperoni and they sure did the job.  

Prices were standard for Vegas ($5-$6 a slice I think). 

All in all, Secret Pizza lived up to my hype, I would definitely come back here when I am back in the area and recommend it to any pizza lover, especially for later in the night.

Love this little hole in the wall. The restaurant is not listed on the directory. The pizza was amazing! The hall was decorated cute as well. 

We will definitely be return patrons!

Go to the 3RD FLOOR and look for a HALLWAY full of pictures and DUN DUN DUN, you're in the secret pizza lair. Lol

The pizza is on point! CRISPY crust and ooey gooey cheeeese like that NINJA TURTLE PIZZA !
-COWABUNGA DUUUUDES!

Def gotta put that Parmesan, Peppers, and Garlic Powder!
The cheese pizza and white slice pizza are hella bomb 
-the toppings are just the icing on the cake

People call it secret pizza but it seems like everybody in Cosmo knows about it! 
If you really appreciate pizza, try this spot out!

Not so secret as people would say but the pizza is really good.  Open 24 hours and I found it to be the busiest after club hours.  There will be a long line through their hallway and out into the hotel.  I won't wait but I've seen people wait over an hour for the pizza.  Thin crust pizza with a tasty sauce and they never skimp on the cheese.
Always a treat. Evert trip to vegas this is a must. Veggie slice and cheese are great.

Not so secret place anymore. Their pepperoni pizza is super salty and nothing too special. However, their white pizza is pretty awesome. If you like garlic, definitely a must.  Price: $5.50/slice and $28/whole pizza.... on the pricey side but it's a Vegas experience.
Have to admit.. Slices reminds me of Brooklyn!!  Too bad it's in a casino.  If they open a location outside of the strip.  I would go there often. Togo is recommend

Bonne adresse de pizza, de belles part a manger sur place ou de grandes pizza  emporter.

L'endroit se trouve au 2me tage du cosmopolitan (3me niveau !) au fond d'un couloir avec des affiches, pas facile  trouver mais il suffit de demander, il n'y a pas de pancartes et il n'apparat sur aucun plan.

On y va pour les pizzas, pas pour le lieu.

3.5 stars but I'll round up to 4 because our first experience was good. 

Located on the 3rd floor down a discreet hallway inside the Cosmopolitan. 

My bf and I shared 3 slices. I wanted to come back here for their Sicilian pizza but they said there was a 20 minute wait for it. So we ordered a cheese pizza added with mushrooms and sausage, white pizza, and one they had on display, which was a cheese with meatball and ricotta. Out of the three, the white was our favorite, and the meatball and ricotta was delicious too. However, the mushrooms on the cheese pizza with sausage was way too undercooked. It was a disappointment. Maybe it was because we asked to add them as a custom order. 

Service was slightly rude. The guy taking our orders seemed grumpy. The tables were also very messy and we had to clean up the cheese and napkins scattered over the tables ourselves. 

I'd come back here for the Sicilian pizza if I'm around the strip.

- Fantastic atmosphere (hidden oldskool pizza joint within the Cosmo where you can get your PacMan on while waiting for smelly good pizza) 

- Fantastic pizza (take away to your room or hangout in the Cosmo and enjoy a fancy cocktail with a homemade fresh ingredient pizza pie) 

- Two thumbs way up! (this place has become a new vegas staple for me)

It's actually pretty easy to find, when you see the photos on the Internet and walk around the third floor of Cosmo. The place definitely has a buzz, because it is secret, because it caters to late night party goers, because everyone is excited to see what comes out of the oven. It's a pick a slice of whatever comes out fresh at the moment.

It's thin crust pizza with your regular cheese, pepperoni, veggie, sausage, etc options. It's a bit pricey with $11 or so for 2 slices. Though, it's fun to be in on a secret. Plus, there is a such an interesting variety of seating choices outside. There is a pool, couches, tables from various other restaurants. It's fun to pick a place to sit.

What is it about finding (and showing) this place that makes me so happy?? I feel like a local and I love it.

The pizza: the crust is really good, the cheese is nice and melty, the cool guy behind the counter lets you pick your slice BUT the sauce is just bland.

A solid choice, but not the best.

By "secret" they really mean secret. There are no signs anywhere and it's literally hidden at the end of a dark hall. 

As for the pizza itself it was afford (rare around here) and amazing. 5/5 if you can find the place.

Always my favorite, I've got the secret directions down now, lol. I'm a big foodie and my pizza standards are high (Tony Gemignani) now I know no one can make pizza like him but at midnight, in Vegas... this works well. Cosmo
Should think of getting a Pizza Rocks or a Tony's Pizza, then I may never stay anywhere else

So yummy! Great for a night time snack after the club to even out that alcohol or for lunch during the day. It's a cool hidden little place. A slice will cost you $5-6. Favorites include cheese, pepperoni, and sausage. The line can get REALLY long. Like 20 people in front if you long, so be ready to deal with that. There are a few barstools and chairs to eat inside the place, but I like bringing it out and sitting in the lounge area the Cosmo hotels provide. If you have an extra dollar to spare you can add it to the wall where people leave messages on money and mark your trip.

We were in Vegas for the marathon. After running, my husband and I were looking for a place to eat so we looked up places through Yelp and found this place. This place had great reviews and pizza sounded like great food after running. We checked it out and it held up to the expectations that people wrote about. The staff were extremely friendly, we only waited maybe 5 minutes from the time we got in line until the time we paid (some reviews say it does get super busy later in the evening but we got there at a decent time), and the pizza was really, really good! My husband and I only got the cheese pizza but it was perfect for us - great cheese to sauce ratio (the sauce was delicious), great crust (good crunch throughout the whole pizza), and not a lot of grease. After eating here all my husband wanted everyday thereafter was pizza for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. It really is a secret place. There are no signs but it is located on the third floor down a hallway across from the pool tables. The hallway is filled with pictures on the wall.

Soooo worth the hunt! We got there about 10 min before they opened on sunday and so when we were looking for it the hallway was blocked off, which threw us off... But then we peaked behind the wall and saw the secret hallway! 

The directions from other yelpers was super helpful! Cosmo, 3rd floor, by the pool table and sushi place. one of the pizza makers peaked his head out and let us in right at 11am. 

The deliciousness could be smelled as we walked down the hallway... we were first in line, and within 5 min the place was pretty packed. my sister and I shared a cheese, pepperoni, white and meat lovers... All were amazing. I think the best though might have been the cheese. Flavor was great, greasy thin crust goodness. And I'm normally a deep dish girl. 

I brought 4 others with me and they all LOVED it. One actually got back in line for a third... And a canolli! normally I'm not a cannoli fan, but this one had super thick cream, almost a cheesecake consistency... Pretty good. But come for the pizza!

Love this place! Will make it a vegas tradition from now on!

Great variety of pizzas ranging between $5-6.50! It wasn't that difficult to find - it's on the 3rd floor of the cosmopolitan, left to the escalator. We went at noon and there wasn't a line. The pizzas were delicious! We shared the mushroom and pepperoni and both were yummy. The crust was thin enough and it was crispy at the edge. Overall, highly recommended!!
This place was soo good!! Be sure to ask someone where to find it because it truly is a secret!! Great cheap good slice on the strip!
Poor food.  Poor selection.  No free water.  High price.  No where to sit.  Extremely poor customer service.

My friends and I hit up Secret Pizza on our last trip to Vegas, and it surely didn't disappoint!
We had heard so much about it from friends, and on our last night out we stopped by around 2 am for a slice. The line wasn't real long when we got there, but it was out past the hallway by the time we left!
The whole experience is pretty awesome. You can't smell the pizza outside of the hallway, and there is no sign, so it feels like you've made a quirky little discovery when you pop in.
I am a pizza purist, so I stuck with a regular pepperoni. It wasn't the best pizza I've had, but it was pretty great! Not too much cheese or sauce, and it was so hot and fresh. We waited a couple minutes for a fresh pizza because they had just run out of the pepperoni, and it was so worth it.
I definitely recommend Secret Pizza to anyone, whether you're looking for a bite after walking the strip, or you've got the munchies after a few hours of partying. It's cheap, fast, and delish!

Great pizza in Vegas!
Hidden gem.
I won't eat pizza at any other place while I'm in Vegas.
Clean.  Not much room in the place so you will have to take it out to the billiard seating area.
We only had the plain pie.  You can tell a lot about a place when they can make an amazing pie without any toppings. 
Growing up in NJ, I was spoiled with all the great pizza joints in NJ and NY.
It's been tough finding a great pizza place on the west coast.  This one tops my list so far.

Drive all the way from LA to eat this pizza & every time it is amazing. Tastes so bomb, especially after the club. A long line is nothing when you have an explosion of flavor in your mouth with every bite. so in love
The best kept secret on the strip. The pizza is delicious and simple. The staff are friendly and quick, so the long line goes quickly. A must-go after a night out.

A friend of mine brought me here on one of our trips to Vegas! I can't tell you how many times I have been to the Cosmopolitan and have never seen this place! Its a bit pricey to me, but the pizza is fantastic!

Ok, is this really a secret? I was impressed, since I had not heard of it and when I decided to go hunt for it, all I knew was that it was in the Cosmopolitan. As I combed the floors, I felt like I was playing a game of clue. It did not matter who I asked, the answer was the same, "If I tell you it will no longer be a secret". I pursued it and believe me it was worth the hunt. The pizza was excellent, with the crust crunchy to the center and the toppings were generous. I swear, it was like playing hard to get, the more I could not find it the more I wanted it. If you are out downtown and are able to drunkenly find it, it will taste even better. The later it is the longer the line and they are open until 4:00am...Delicious and so Vegas!

Damn. This pizza is amazing. I tried one if the white slices and another that had sausage and ricotta. It totally lives up to the hype. Came on Friday around 1030pm and the line wasnt too bad at all. They have a very cramped eating space, but there are couches outside the secret pizza hallway to sit on. Highly recommend!

Secret pizza is amazing. You will not find this place with ease since there's no sign but I guess that's part of the fun. You go down a hallway of pictures in to the shop, stand in line and order your slice or full pie. They warm it in the oven and serve. No seating, just a few areas to stand and eat. 
Ordered a slice of cheese and a slice of meatball ricotta and recommend both. They were both tasty. My 3 year old pizza monster wanted another slice the next day!
Wonderful pizza. I had it on four different occasions while staying at the Cosmopolitan. Really good stuff!

A perfect example of why Yelp sucks the soul out of me ... if this place can't get five stars then what can? It's cool because it's impossible to find in a city that outrageously promotes itself ... and much more importantly, the slice is great.  I got a pepperoni and mushroom ... it was fresh and tasty.  Plus I hadn't had a drop to drink, and it was great.  Just imagine what it would taste like after a night of drinking!

Cheap eats in a fantastic hotel on the Las Vegas strip. Long lines on the weekend evenings but worth it. Get your slice and a PBR draft then settle into the lounge area out front and watch some pool, foosball or just people watch.

I most loved the laid back atmosphere and friendly staff. It was fun trying to find the "restaurant" (not that hard, actually -- if you're coming from the pedestrian walkway, just take the escalator to the third floor and walk to the little hallway in front of you).

The pizza itself is $5 a slice, but one slice was sufficient for me. There is seating down the hallway from the pizza shop. I was there on a Wed for lunch, so there was no line. All in all a good, casual lunch.

By the way, I snagged a cannoli to try it out, and they definitely add some kind of orange flavor to it. I'm more of a traditionalist when it comes to my cannoli, apparently, so I wasn't over the moon, but It did have nice texture!

Places like this are why I love Yelp.  Would never have known to look for it otherwise.  Cool little hole in the wall (literally).  We had a basic half cheese half pepperoni.  Took a while to make from scratch but it was worth it.  Nothing extremely different about it, but it was one of those very well executed thin crust pizza's that I love. On par with some of the best I've had.  

Not a lot of room to sit, so plan to grab a spot in the nearby lounge.
A hidden gem on the Cosmo's 3rd floor. Just spent a week in NYC, and Secret Pizza's slices were even better than the Big Apple's IMHO.

The first few months of opening this place rocked. It's a nice little hidden spot at cosmo down the hall from the glass elevators on the third floor. So since opening they have cut the portions in half, the pizza is as thin as paper to begin with now the slices are 50% of the original size and the size of real NYC pizza and $4 a slice or more!! And get this a little red party cup 8oz of soda beverage is $3.25

Avoid this rip off joint and go someplace else. 

What a joke! Get a clue your pizza isn't that great!!!

this place is stupid but i'll eat here when i'm drunk off of comped drinks from gambling 3 dollars in 3 hours and love it. truth be told it's good, cheap pizza whether you are drunk or not. check it out!
Good lord this is the best pizza west of New York!!!

This is just your typical pizza by the slice stand. Nothing special. Based on other reviews that said, "best pizza on the strip." I went out of my way to the Cosmo to try this pizza. What I got was a couple steps up from a Sbarro pizza found in every mall across America. 

I was going to rate 2 stars, but the pizza was decent, just not what I was expecting and kind of plain. Maybe that's my bad. But be warned and don't make the same mistake I did. Not worth a cab ride across town to eat here. Also, Project Pie at MGM is much better.
Great New York style pizza! Not allowed at the pool though. Lines are long but in true New York fashion they move it along.
Their pizza is so delicious!!!! It's kind of expensive, but what isn't in Vegas? I found this place on yelp and was so pleased :) I will be back here when I am in Vegas and am craving so good pizza.

This is very secret place, they have no sign, its very difficult to find them.  It's on the 3 rd floor right around the corner.  I tried two different slices of pizza.  It's ok, nothing wow wow .....and is expensive.  $5.5 per slice and $4 for soda.  It took me 20mins waiting on the queue for slice of pizza and very salty.

For you in the know it's actually Nico's pizzeria.

This may be the best pizza I have ever head.  Yes it's oxygen filled Vega$, yes I just came from a dance floor table at the Marquee, yes it's 4, no 5, no something a.m. 

Regardless, I'm an eastcoaster from Scranton, PA and we have a small Italian town called Old Forge where New Yorkers flock to actually eat real, authentic Italian pizza, trust me it gets no better, AND THEN Nico's.

The Sunrise pizza great - even better- I asked them to put tomatoes on it- yum- both nights in Vega$ ended up here- not at some crappy craps table or seedy strip club.

Thanks Nico!

You guys Rock!

Felt like I just grabbed a slice on the boardwalk. Yelp reviewers are right on with this spot. A tiny place tucked away on the third floor of the cosmopolitan. I'm not a huge pizza gal because I don't like a lot of bread and red sauce so this spot maybe me very happy. Crispy thin crust and the offer white slices. Great oil and garlic flavor. Two slices were too much but who knows when I'll be able to have a great slice like this again.  Perfect for lunch and in assuming amazing after drinking.

They are located down an inconspicuous hallway right next to Blue Ribbon Sushi. The hallway is covered in really cool old Italian records.

The prices are totally reasonable, and the pizza was great. I had a slice of the white pizza, and my husband had a slice of the  sausage pizza & the pepperoni. All three were delicious. Super thin crust, tasty toppings, and they heat it up for you, so the cheese is extra melty.

There are not a lot of places to sit, but it just adds to the big city, pizzeria atmosphere that it seems they are trying to create.  The staff was really friendly also.  It is definitely worth checking out while you are in Vegas.

Some Great thin crust Pizza!!!!
I have a slice every time im in the Cosmo!!!

Rolling with 5 stars here because if you want pizza at 3 or 4am and stumble on THIS place, this is genius; you will be a very happy camper.  If this were on the corner in your town, probably 4 stars.

Walking into this place, we half-expected the small crowd to turn with a welcoming cheer, like, "you made it into our club!"  We felt like the Coors Light ice climbers were about to pop up with 2 beers for our hidden party.  

It was almost comical...but also super simple.  The counter where we order suggested the Pizza Re-heater Guy might belt out a "No pizza for you!" if we strayed from any specific club parlance.   

This was like a bonus while staying at Cosmopolitan.  If we weren't staying there, I'd definitely have walked down the strip late night for a slice or two.  Or three.

Stopped here on my way from SLC to CA for a break and to see The Strip. We were lucky enough to snag two seats and quickly scarf it down then take our beers for a stroll. The prices are pretty reasonable and the pizza is above average. Service can be slow and the line can grow long rapidly. I'll be back in Vegas in a few days and will definitely be back if I want a snack while out on The Strip.

Pretty awesome, secret location. The white pizza has large balls of cheese that made my mouth water. The combination was full of yummy toppings.  Totally recommend this place. Of you plan on having more than one slice, just buy the pie!

Secret Pizza; great spot for late night snack... By the slice or wait a few minutes and get the entire pie. Try the ones beyond pepperoni, I had a four cheese one that was quite nice, and a sausage,pepperoni, and goat cheese that was awesome.

Among the best pizza I've ever had- definitely the best in Vegas! Went there 2 out 2 nights on my last Vegas trip. I tried all sorts of slices, but liked the meatball and mushroom best. I don't normally like white pizza, but this one is great.

Fun, mellow, atmosphere. A welcome break from all the Vegas lights and sin and what not.

They had PBR and Stone IPA on tap, which was a really cool combination. Satisfied everyone who wanted beer with their pizza.

Not going to lie: I ate too many slices at one point and had a tummy ache for all of the next day, but I'm about 100% sure that was my fault, not their's. It's just so good.

Pizza is great. The size and taste is perfect. 2 was just enough for me. We came at the right time... No line. But once we were leaving, the line was going out the door. By how good the pizza is, I'd say it's worth the wait. If you're staying at the Cosmo or done clubbing at Marquee, Secret Pizza is the place to go to satisfy your hunger needs.
Loved the food...no need to be drunk to eat it! Went on a non-busy day and received great service.

Amazing new york style pizza restaurant.  I have no idea why they hide this in a alley between the sushi and mexican restauarent

Great taste!
Excellent pizza and fun atmosphere. Loved it. Very hard to fine. Located inside the Cosmopolitan hotel and casino. Third floor near Blue Ribbon. No sign - just gotta look for it!
Well besides the gimmick (a well performed gimmick) I'd say the pizza is good but still not worth the charge. 28 dollars for a large white pizza..come on will ya?

The real secret about the "Secret Pizza Spot" is that it's really easy to get a free slice. Try this. Wait for the hipster concert to be over so you can get that long line. Order a slice, and simply moonwalk your way out of there. Everyone is so slammed and busy that they wont even notice. It's that easy.

Amazing pizza!!! One of the best things I've ever eaten in Las Vegas. It's pizza, basic pizza, nothing crazy or insanely complicated like so many "fancy" Vegas meals can be but it's so delicious! It's perfect for a quick lunch or maybe a bite to eat after a night out.

I thought this place closed down?  Last time we were in Vegas (Labor day weekend, 2013) we tried to go there and it was closed, but I see reviews of this place and they are recent.  Does anyone know if they were closed for a while?  We are going back in 2 weeks and I want to make sure we get some pizza from there if it's open again.  Delicious!

Definitely not impressed. To be honest, I think chain pizza places like Domino's and Papa John's are much better than this. The concept is cool, a secret pizza place hidden at the end of a hallway that's extremely easy to miss if you're not looking. (I didn't even know this place existed and I've eaten in Jaleo and DOCG right next to this place!) The hallway is fun to look at while waiting in line, as it's plastered with old  vinyl record covers. 

I had the white pizza slice and another with ricotta and sun dried tomatoes. Both were very oily, and tasted like they had been sitting out for a while. The cheese was not stretchy, ooey, or gooey, but rather sort of dry. Also very salty. 

Maybe I would have better thoughts of the food here if I hadn't come sober. But then everything tastes amazing after a few drinks.

SO GOOD!! Tried it for the first time. Got white pizza for $5 and it was simply CHEESEY GOODNESS! They reheat the pizza for you so when you it's nice and crispy when you eat! Though this place isn't very secret anymore since the line gets pretty long, it's worth the wait! Perfect place to go after clubbing at Marquee since it's open til 5 am. There's not that much room for you to sit and eat inside, but there's a seating area right outside with a pool table. Definitely a good place to stop by in Cosmo!

Yes there's usually a long line, but it's definitely worth the wait! I really wanted the Sicilian slice but they didn't have it, so I just got a slice of pepperoni and mushroom. My girls and I also ordered a whole pie up to our room (we were staying at Cosmo) and devoured it within minutes. Bread was thin enough and had a nice crisp to it.

I am not sure what the hype is about. The white pizza was probably one of the worse I have eaten. I ate 1 and a half slices before I had to give it up.
It may be a requirement to be drunk to enjoy (or not care) this pizza. Surely hunger cannot persuade one to say this is good pizza.
At $28 for a single pie, I am very displeased. I'm adding a photo.

Needs to be renamed "Everyone and their mama's know this pizza joint" Pizza.

The line is ridiculously long after a night of drinking/clubbing.  There's a reason why there's a line.  It's pretty damn good.  New York pizza got some competition.  Not so long of a line during the early day.

Remember that Seinfeld episode where Jerry tries to pour out the grease on the pizza and George goes "you're crazy" and pours Jerry's pizza juice on his pizza?  Yeah, this pizza got that pizza "juice" (not grease).

Cheesy, greasy, and deletable meatball topping.  Yum!  Got New York prices too, but hey, it's Vegas, where $50 all of sudden feels like its only $10.

If you don't like flavor and a little saltiness, might be a little too much for your taste buds.

It's really good.  Definitely check it out.

So after reading about a "secret pizza" place at the Cosmopolitan I knew I had to try it. I found it pretty easy to locate after finding directions to it online. 

There was a queue when I arrived but nothing too long and considering it was a Saturday night I had expected others to be there.  While waiting the gentleman behind me told me this was his second trip that day and he said he was a 'pizza snob'. I decided to keep it simple and went for a plain cheese pizza. The slices are far bigger than any kind of pizza slice you would get in the UK.  It cost about $5.

It did not disappoint the pizza tasted great! I would recommend to anyone visiting to give it a try. As it is opened late it's a good late night spot!

S.S.A.P =  Secret Soggy Ass Pizza.  Albeit the ingredients were all fresh and great quality the execution of the pizza fell apart...literally.  The crust could not support the fats from the cheese and meats which made the crust completely marry in with the cheese to create this flimsy, greasy slice.  I understand that who makes the pizza makes the difference in the outcome so maybe the cooks had an off day.  I went in at around 1 pm on Saturday on 1/25/2014 and had the white pizza and meat lovers.  There was no line but was told by some that the line is usually off the hook.  There is so much more to experience foodie wise in Vegas, especially off the strip.  If you are looking for a cheap eat in a pizza form Bonnanos on the strip does the job and a much better tasting slice or if you want similar to east coast style pizza  Grimaldis at the Venetian is amazing...pricey but worth it.  Foodies leave this place behind to the drunkards coming off that club high and let the grease soaks up all their sins cuz lord knows this place has enough greasy pizza to purify everyone in Vegas!

Stopped by on a Friday night ended up going to Eggslut instead. Came back the next day and waited in line to see what all the buzz is about. The pizza was OK.. I think this place is mainly hyped up on the whole secret spot. The price is high for the quality but then again I've had a lot of good pizza. Don't think I will be returning but will be back at Eggslut :D

What are people judging this place on????  Is it the food or the atmosphere?  The atmosphere sucked.  There are barely any stools and the counters were dirty.  I went here totally sober and the pizza is just mediocre.  It's not bad, it just okay.  I wouldn't go out of my way to come here for pizza as it's not that special.   

On the other hand, if I was totally wasted and starving at 3am in the morning after a night of partying... then this place certainly makes sense.  Guys don't bring your girl here on a date!  And girls if your bf brings you here on a date, take my advice and ditch him.  Your guy is just cheap and you deserve better.

After days of buffets, I was done and looking for some yummy comfort food.  I had been itching to go to Secret Pizza since I heard about it months ago, and I'm so happy that I found it!! This is thin crust pizza at its best.  Perfectly crispy and cheesy.  I had the white pizza and mushroom, both the BEST pizza I've had outside of New York (seriously)!  For $5 a slice, it was totally worth it.  The place really wasn't hard to find if you know where to go.  It's on the third floor between Blue Ribbon Sushi and Jaleo.  I know it's supposed to be "secret pizza," but I'm not saying anything that people at the hotel wouldn't know or you can't find through a Google search anyhow.

This is the best pizza place in town they fly all the ingredients in from the East Coast the water the ingredients everything they make their own homemade meatballs that are phenomenal every style pizza from New York to Chicago definitely a have to eat 4  All you Foodies and pizza Lover you can't go there just once you go many many times and the line moves very quick

I love pizza! And this place is not somewhere I'd like to come back to. First of all, this place should change their $ to $$ because for 3 slices of pizza, 1 soda and 1 beer, it was $30!!! Insane, right? I wouldn't mind paying if the quality was there. But unfortunately, it wasn't. 

I love the concept of it being a secret and the fun is finding it. But once we found it, I was expecting to be rewarded with some great pizza. Pizza was salty and a little brunt. The ingredients felt short in quality and quantity. I hate to say this but I would have been more satisfied and happy having Costco pizza. 

Secret pizza, you need to start serving better pizzas with better ingredients or just stay a secret but this is one secret no one wants to know about. 

Happy eating everyone :)

This place was definitely worth it and the line was only about 5 min on a Friday evening. The place is very small so try and grab a seat outside first or take it to go and eat it on the go. They provide you a big box that you can tear into plates. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. We ordered 4 slices of pizza and a salad with salami, which was actually pretty good. They warm up pizza by the slice for you or they can make you one. It's a little pricey at 5+ a slice but nothing in the cosmo is going to be cheap. 

Pizza was nice and thin but not too thin. The crust was crunchy and not too thick. The salad was fresh and salami was good with spice. Get the salad to make it feel like you're not too fat.

The place was harder to find because of reading the reviews. Just go up the escalators to the third floor and it's a small hallway with records on the wall, located to the right of the pool tables. It's next to some open walled restaurant. You'll be okay trying to find it but there are no signs like posts say.
Secret pizza is apparently the perfect name for this place! I walked around til my phone died trying to locate it and had no luck.

super big slices
kinda pricey, but what isn't in vegas
can almost compete with pizza from new york
def can compete against them when you've consumed some alcohol

it's on the cosmo side closest to las vegas blvd. we walked from the vdara side...so it was along walk.

Holy hell. Delish. We walked in here for lunch. Hubby and I were trying to figure out what to eat. Tummies were grumbling. We then smell the place. Yes, standing outside you can smell it. We walk in to a simple, no frills pizza joint. Huge slices done right. It was yummy. Add a soda and you have yourself a yummy lunch that doesn't break the bank and hits the spot after a long night of gaming or partying. Try it out! Across the STK at the Cosmo. There is no sign. Love that part too.

Super tasty!  I got the white slice, and it hit the spot.  There's not much seating inside, but right outside is a little area with a pool table and nice furniture to sit on.  Soda is crazy expensive for a little pizza joint, but they have free water, and the wine comes in a giant cup :)

Super bad i saw it in yelp it was one of the most reviewed restaurants , so i decide to visit it but i don't know how they gave it more than one star !!! Oily and cold also they just warm the pizza so you don't know when they made it !!
Pizza was quite good.  Nice crust.  It's a little hidden and hard to find.  I think price is a little much for a pizza slice.

This pizza is OK  at best.

$3.50 for a "New York" slice that tastes nothing like what I got in all my time in NYC
$3.50 for a fountain-drink

-Save money, walk around the cosmo casino floor, get your drink and pop up and grab a slice, out of a group of 8, I was the only one that did not do that, the fountain drink comes in a red-dixie cup with no lid.


I understand for some, this is better than the chain food, but seriously, not the best pizza in the world.

The entrance can be hard to find, I was on the right floor but just confused with all the resto's, lucky for me, a security worker pointed out the entry. 

I am glad I can say I tired this place for the sake of all the people that go to Vegas and wish they could. But on my next trip, I will skip the Pizza.

Don't be confused by the other Italian place on the second floor of the Cosmopolitan that has a sign and everything -- The "secret" place is on the third floor near the other restaurants. No place to sit, but good spot to grab a quick slice that could fit in in NYC.

After reading other yelp reviews on this place I decided to head down after work.true to what other yelpers gave stated, it is difficult to find.I decided to try the white pizza, which has no sauce and has garlic and ricotta cheese. chatted up the cute redhead cashier who's name I did not catch(hi, if you're reading this) and enjoyed my slice.the slice was greasy as hell and tasted good. it definitely is worth a repeat though.

I love pizza; it's my favorite food. I am also very particular about how it's prepared. So I was very apprehensive about the quality of pizza I was going to get at this joint located in the cosmo in las vegas. But after a night at marquee and knowing that my room was only 5 minutes away, I decided to grin and bear it and try the place out. The line was humongous and I could have taken a taxi to and back from spring mt road during that wait, but let me tell you it was definitely worth it. The pizza here is the real deal new york style, the way I like it. The set-up is also classic corner pizzeria, none of that vegas glitz and bling. Nothing else to add, other than the wait sucks and it's like 5 bucks a slice, hence the 4 stars.

This place is obviously no secret anymore due to its delicious pizza! Went around midnight and the line wasn't too long, but it can definitely get busy. The pizza is a little pricy, but that is to be expected when you're eating in Vegas.

Although it's pretty much an open secret at this point, do not visit the cosmopolitan late at night without visiting secret pizza. It's greasy, delicious, and very satisfying. Just follow the drunk people up the escalator and look for the long hallway (and line).

I happen to adore the white pizza and anything with mushrooms, but honestly  all the flavors look awesome. Yes, the prices are higher than the flyover state you might call home, but you will likely be tipsy and exhausted by the time you make it over so you won't mind.

The very worst thing about this place is standing in line and watching what feels like an endless number of people walk past you with yummy slices. It will take a while if you are in the post club crowd. Don't expect a whole pizza either on a busy night- you could be looking at an hour wait or more (after you wait 30+ minutes in line).

We enjoyed our first visit to secret pizza. The prices were high but expected for the strip. Service was very friendly and fast. Pizza was delicious. I would recommend it and we will probably be back.

Delicious pizza can be found here if you can locate the place! I had the white, and a slice of regular cheese, and they were both fantastic! A bit hefty price-wise, which is the only reason I'm not marking it 5 stars, but still, some damn good pizza.

One of the best pizzas I've ever had I can easily say this is in my top 3. If your in the Cosmopolitan Hotel or even out in the town one late night and feel like a quick and good priced bite to eat with out cutting out the flavor this is your place to go.

Pizza is pretty darn good!  Lines are long though.  I was buying a full size pizza and was able to just order by phone and pick it up 30 minutes later.  I definitely recommend placing order over the phone if you want a whole pizza or pizzas.  If you want just a few slices, then I guess you gotta wait in the line.  Affordable for Vegas Hotel prices and great atmosphere (hidden hallway, Lol).
This place is awesome! Great hole in the wall. Delicious. Flavorful. Quick service. You can sit on the limited chairs inside or right outside in the lounge area. I loved my white pizza!
Pizza is really good! Not really a secret though cause everyone obviously knows about it. Easy to find too. Lines can be a little long sometimes.
The pizza was amazing - perfect temp and tasted amazing. Def would recommend / will go back when we are back in town

Ok so this little gem of a pizza place is hidden down a hallway next to Blue Ribbon Sushi in the Cosmo. If my friend didn't tell me about it I wouldn't have know it existed. I got two slices, one a pepperoni and another one with all meat. It was freaking awesome. It reminded me of pizza I ate in NYC. Good thin crisp crust with quality meats. It was so good that I went back for breakfast before catching my plane home.
Four star pizza, four star price. You get what you pay for here - it's good stuff. Kind of hard to find, hence the name. Just look for all the people walking out of a narrow hallway with pizza boxes.
Secret Pizza is secret.  Tucked in a corner they have some great pizza to sling out of their little corner store.  Line was out the door but worth the wait.

The pizza had too much cheese.  What this place has going for it is it is relatively inexpensive and casual in a city that is over the top.  I think if people were sober, they would not like the pizza as much.

The not so secret, secret wasn't too hard to find. There was a line, but it moved quickly. Settled on the cheese - it was good. Pretty typical of by the slice pizza - not worth making your way across town for, but if you're in the area and want something cheap, I'd recommend checking it out.

Serve pizza and pizza only! but its all they can sell when theyre slammed on the strip! Great pizza, possibly the best crust in town! Sauce is sweet, cheese tastes like a NY brand! Love it! My dad is here every week, since he works at the Jockey Club next door! whenever I have a few extra dollars (expensive on the strip), and its late at night nowhere to go on a slow Tuesday, this is my spot! and well worth it!

"Found" this place while on a late night mission to find this place. First off, this is not your typical Vegas spot to eat, you get your pizza on a paper plate and drinks in a red solo cup, it feels hearty and like your back at a college house party with the best f***ING pizza you've had sober or drunk. I went with the white pizza and I still have dreams about it. The bad part, all other pizza seems blah after eating from this place... not even sure what it's really called?!?

Thanks to Yelp for suggesting this pizza spot in Las Vegas. As others have said it is a little hard to find, but worth it. Very flavorful thin pizza for a decent price.  

The spot is located on the third floor of the Cosmopolitan Hotel/Casino. It is to the right of the Japanese restaurant and has no signs. Best to order well in advance if you want carry out. 

The line for walk in guests could take a while.

Like everyone says, this is an unadvertised pizza "hole-in-the-wall" joint (if you can call a place with marble counters and tin ceiling moldings a hole-in-the-wall) on the 3rd floor of the Cosmo located down a long hallway between Blue Ribbon and Jaleo. You'll know you're going down the right hallway when you see a pinball machine at the end. 

Honestly, this is the closest to NYC style that I've had since grabbing a slice before jumping through the turnstiles to catch the Lexington express down to 42nd St in high school. The thin crust, just greasy enough cheese, and sauce with faint chunks of tomato skin were all on point, fugetdaboutit. If you love you some NYC style, do yourself a favor and seek this joint out.
Best pizza ever and the price is totally worth it. Nice crust, nice texture, nice crunch and great flavors

Good but not really anything special... located on the 3rd floor next to STK. My bf and I came here before the Britney concert. Don't know what all the hype is about. This is a good place for post club eats but wouldn't come seeking out for it. I got the white pizza and bf got the meatlover. His was super greasy! 

All n all- nothing too special, but it is convenient if you want a quick bite.

Okay, the location was truly a "secret".  Once we found it, we were very impressed.  It was great pizza. It was a little more on the greasy side than we like our pizza, but it was still pretty good.  If we are ever in Vegas again, we will definitely go back.

The pizza was so good I ended up going back the next day. 
Great price with quick and excellent service.

I am a lover of New York style thin crust pizza and this place definitely delivered. At this visit, I tried a slice with meatballs and pepperocinis and a meat lovers. They had the right mixture of heat, grease, sauce and cheese. I will definitely be going back next time I'm in Vegas.

Amazing and in my favorite Hotel/Casino!!!  You can order a whole pie for your room or enjoy it after a late night. 

Staff is always friendly!  Crust has great flavor to...this is always important!!  The toppings and combos are endless!!  This is as close to NYC pizza as you can get in Vegas!
This place is not listed on the hotel directory but outbids next to the entrance of the boulevard

This was probably one of my favorite places to eat while in Vegas. The price was awesome for 1 slice of pizza. I absolutely fell in love with the Meatball and Ricotta pizza. Got it 3 separate times!! The line may look long, but it's well worth it and they put your ordered slices back into the oven to make it a fresh delicious slice. Definitely a must if in/near the Cosmopolitan. 

Location: 3rd floor down the long hallway. There's no sign (hence: Secret) but have fun hunting! You won't regret it.

We tried the pepperoni and white pizzas. The crust was thin and crispy - probably the best thin crust I've had (although I've never eaten pizza in New York). True, it's like $5/slice, but it sure hit the spot.

I've had Secret pizza a few times because I work at the Cosmopolitan and I have to say that I don't really get the hype. I've never tried it when I was drunk though, so maybe that is the key. The slices are big and the crust is pretty good, but other than that, I really don't see why everyone says its "the best pizza I've ever had". Its mediocre at best. Try the cheesecake though, its pretty good for being in a small little pizza place.
Small joint in the Cosmo But.... Staff was so friendly. Pizza was good. Very good. I recommend this joint for a good piece of pizza. Lines are long after 5.  Shhhhhh. Its a secret

yumm, ask for a slice of white pie or pepporoni pie, after 1am extra long lines

best pie on the strip, one of my best top 3 pies. after 1am geet ready to wait, this is the go to spot for late night munchies after the club to sober up, white pie & pepporoni, are my faves, if theirs more then 2-3 of you are better off buying a whole pie, you are better off calling it in, it is between blue ribbon sushi and some mexican joint ithink on the 3rd floor. another bonus its in expensive $5 a slice and you cant beat that for on strip eats
Not sure what all the hype is all about but taste like regular pizza that you can pretty much get from anywhere...

3.5 stars

Location: third floor of Cosmo (floor dedicated to food at the top). When you go up the escalator you should see a lounge-ish area to your left (some chairs, etc.). Walk over there. Then look to your right. You should see a short walkway where the walls are lined with old records and the like. Bam! Secret Pizza entrance. 

Pizza: Pizza was a-ok. We got one piece of pepperoni and some sort of sausage and another piece with pepperoni and mushroom. Tasty and thin without being burnt. I can't say this is the best pizza ever (not even close) but a good and (relatively) cheap bite to eat. ("relatively" because it still seemed pricey to me for what it was). 

Oh! And they have a Galaga arcade game you can play for 50 cents. Warning! The controller has some serious jamming issues, though!

Secret!?  This place is about as secret as the fact that Donald Trump has a comb over...

Okay, Secret Pizza isn't secret, but they make some surprisingly legit NY-style pizza.  They serve three kinds of New York style pizza here: red, white, and Sicilian.  I'm still Jonesing for the Sicilian (they were out the two times I visited trying to get a slice); of the other two types, I think they're both exceptional examples of NY's finest.  My favorite of the two so far was the red, with Sausage, Pepperoni and garlic.  Both red and white slices are made with premium, super-sized, toppings and the crust is great tasting, chewy, soggy at all, and shaped exactly the way NY pizza should be shaped.

There are no signs announcing either the presence or location of Secret Pizza.  Legend has it it started out as a room-service pizza source built for guests, but it was decided before it opened to allow walk-ins from outside the hotel as well.

My friend had read about this place on Yelp and knew where to look in general. However, if we had not known beforehand to be on the lookout we likely would have never found it. It is located down a dimly lit corridor with framed album covers hanging on the wall.  Secret Pizza may be hard to find, but once you do, you'll be a very happy camper!

Wow! This pizza is the real deal NY style and a not to miss place to grab a bite. I tried several slices and really like the cheese only the best. The white had a little too much garlic for me but my friend had a second piece of it. This brings me back to the best pizzas in NYC.

Great New York style pizza by the slice for a decent price on the strip... The pepperoni pizza was awesome with the crust being the best part. It is kind of hard to find as its location is "secret" but this just adds to the fun if eating here. There really isn't much seating in the restaurant area but it's adjacent to plenty of comfortable seating in a lounge area of the resort.
Classic NY pizza. Great crust. Hard to find, but worth it!  Second floor of Cosmopolitan on The Strip.
Great spot esp if you need a quick snack post drinking and gambling. A little pricey but it's the strip!

Overall: Great pizza for a steal in Vegas.

I would have never known about this place if it hadn't been for the nice concierge on the third floor of the Cosmopolitan while my mom and I were wandering around. He walked us over to this huge door and swung it open to reveal a hallway with a pinball game and loud rock music. 

The set-up is similar to a NY pizzeria in that there are no tables, just bars where you can stand and eat or grab an empty stool. I ordered a cheese slice for $3.50 which is unheard of in Vegas. The slice was really good! We went back there a couple of times during our visit when we didn't want to spend an arm and a leg for a meal.

Pretty solid pizza joint. Now, let me preface, I am staying at the Cosmo......would I trek up and down the strip searching for this place if I wasn't staying here?? Maybe. I would say if you are in the nearby vicinity and have a hankering for a decent pie that wont break the bank this is a great place to check out.

We ate here three times, about 11 AM, about 12 PM, and about 9:30 PM on weekdays.  We never had to wait in line but there is limited seating.  The pizza is amazing.  $5 a slice plus 50 cents for each additional topping.  Soda is available for $4 with free refills.  The service was friendly and fast each time.  I tried pizza in two other places - Flamingo (gross) and Flour and Barley (good, but not amazing) and found Secret Pizza to be the winner by far.  If we are anywhere near the Cosmopolitan again we will be back!  Cosmopolitan Hotel 3rd floor unmarked hallway just to left as you get off the escalator.  I had no trouble finding it.

Pizza is good... 
GREAT Marketing.
I think it is a bit pricy.... but what do expect from the strip... If I am nearby and hungry.. sure I would maybe think about it again...
but lack luster service.. red solo cups for drinks.. no seating.. and at best "ok pizza"
its memorable.. but not for the way you would expect...
it is probably the best value at the cosmo.... Not bashing it.. just not impressed either.

Typically a short line and the cheapest good food left on the strip. $5 for a slice of white pizza and their draft beer is cheer than anywhere else I've found on the e strip with food. Overall good food and good experience

The pizza was very good and huge slices but a bit pricey for pizza. The staff was friendly and helpful. To say the least, it is truly a "secret" to find them!  We had to ask a few people and walked around lost for a bit but did finally find them. They had a lot of selections to choose from and our pizza was tasty.  My only problem was the lack of seating. We had to take our pizza out in the outside area to find a place to eat.  It is a tiny space at the end of a hallway and diners stand up to a counter to eat.  Those areas were occupied.  I would eat there again but hope there would be seating next time I get to Vegas.  We were there November 26, 2014

NO JOKE, an absolute must visit when I'm in Vegas and should be for you too! Take the escalators or elevators up to level three and just to the left of Jaleo is an elevator and the unmarked entrance to this place. Go inside, wait if the line is halfway down the hall. Longer? Try to come back but MAKE SURE YOU DO! Delicious thin foldable greasy NY style pizza. I get a slice of white and pepperoni but try any of them. Have one for me!

This place is literally a secret.  It's not on the map or directory at the Cosmopolitan Hotel nor does it have a sign above the entrance saying "Secret Pizza."  It's on the 3rd floor near the elevator.  Enter a long hallway and the place is literally a hole in the wall.

I came here with my boyfriend, and I had the impression that the pizzas would be more unique.  The pizzas are pre-made and each slice is popped in the oven for a few minutes as you order.  We asked the cashier what makes this pizza so great, and she replied, "It's just good pizza."

For $5, we shared one slice of the white pizza, which is topped with ricotta and mozzarella cheese.  I never had an orgasm in my mouth from pizza before, and needless to say, my boyfriend and I should have gotten our own slice.  After devouring that slice of pizza, we pulled out another $5 and ordered a slice of sausage pizza.  That was also very delicious, but I prefer the white pizza.

If you come with a large party, it's best to purchase an entire pizza to share since it's cheaper that way. 

Dominos and Pizza Hut just don't make the cut anymore.  This place is truly a treasure serving just really good pizza.  I wish there was another location in Orange County so I can fully satisfy my pizza cravings.

I eat out 14 times a week, all over the U.S. I think it's time to start giving honest feedback; helping others make informed dining decisions. 

Takeout only:

+Pizza is great. NY style
+The white pizza is freaking awesome!
+Very casual
+I only stay at the Cosmopolitan and I have a slice every day I'm there. 

Overall Score: 96% out of 100%
I highly recommend this restaurant.

The location is really a secret. I mean its inside the Cosmopolitan tucked away that we had to ask a few people to get there. But its gem of a place. The Ricotta and Mozzarella Pie with Jalapeo topping was too good. The guys working over there were very friendly.
Had the banana pepper and sausage pizza.very good....The crispy crust is a perfect cure for a good hangover

Amazing!!!!  Best NY Style pizza I have ever sunk my teeth into!!!
Hard to find, but once you do you will be excited!
Hint Hint!  It is right next to the glass elevator on the 3rd floor!
So yummy.! Not hard to find, the great variety of slices tops it off, hopefully next time I'm there I'll be back for a whole pie.!

We were starving when we got to Vegas. This is the first stop we made. This place is hidden, no signs at all. Located on the 3rd floor of The Cosmopolitan next to the Asian restaurant, there's a small opening. You'll know you're in the right place when you see the wall of records. The staff was friendly and there several kinds of pizza to choose from. Great drunk food, but also great pizza in general. We will definitely be back!

Pizza here was delicious even to a very hungover tummy! Price was super reasonable considering being in the land of over priced everything. It was definitely unmarked but like previous yelpers said its not very hard to find. It's right next to the sushi place and the elevator on the 3rd floor. This will definitely be a staple in our future Vegas adventures.

Highly overrated unless you are drunk individual with no life experience. Bad service and the pizza isn't as good as most people describe. Look at the people reviewing this place and when they are rating. Typically late at night after drinking the night away at Marquee since it's practically next door. Don't believe the New Pizza hype for this place cause if you have had real NY pizza IN NY then You'll understand

One of the closest to NY style pizza in town. The white pizza is sooooo good. It is always busy so go early and plan on waiting.  It is definitely worth the wait. Not much of a sitting area so plan on standing or taking it to go. Yummy.
My go-to snack place when I'm on the Strip because it's delicious and reasonably priced. I like the one with white sauce and garlic.
This pizza is the best pizza on the strip and Veda's. Period. Amazing dough and ingredients if you're picky like me and want quality then come here

Great pizza! Fast and inexpensive, not 2 things I've found anywhere else in the Cosmopolitan Vegas. Love that I had to be shown where it was, because it REALLY is secret. I had the sausage and pepper pizza and loved it. Also loved that a slice and a soda only cost $9!
Best pizza, i've ever had!!  We waited in line for almost an hour and it was well worth it!!  I will DEF be coming back!!!  I had white pizza and a slice of pep, both were delish!

Visited this pizzeria after seeing the high ratings on Yelp. If it wasn't for other reviews on Yelp it would have taken us a long time to find it by ourselves since it is not listed in the directory and there were no signs. However, I get the whole "treasure" hunting idea, which is unique, but when you are hungry or have a tight agenda you don't have time to spend looking for food. Just in case you don't know where the pizzeria is, it is located on the 3rd floor in between two restaurants. We came around 9:30 in the night and didn't have to wait long. The options for pizza are limited but it is good in size. The price is fairly high about $5 to $6 plus any additional toppings for a slice. But you have to take into account that this is Las Vegas!

Two words: White Pizza. 

I'm pretty picky about my pizza being from Chicago but the white pizza at Secret Pizza is probably one of the best slices of pizza I've ever eaten. It has just the right amount of garlic and the fresh ricotta cheese just makes the pizza. My friend and I stumbled upon this place in March and when we returned to Vegas in August this was on the top of our must have food list. The pizza was as amazing as we remembered.

We did split a piece of one of their other pies because they only had two slices left of white pizza when we ordered and we weren't very impressed. It was just okay, kind of flavorless. Definitely stick with the white pizza. You won't regret it.

My best pizza place in Vegas so far!

If you want to sit down and enjoy meal - look somewhere else, but if you are up for a quick tasty bite - don't miss this place!

It is a little hard to find at first and does not have a lot of place to eat, but definitely the best pizza for your money!

Good pizza but I have never been to a place that takes more than 20 minutes to get a slice of pizza. If you are that popular then take a business class and expand the entire place. Also get more employees to get the work done because the 5 people is not getting the job done correctly. Know how a business works and do everything you can to satisfy your customers.
Perfect after a night out in Vegas, if you can find it. The pizza is awesome and the staff is quick and friendly. I'll be back

Let's  be clear on what this is: it's a pizza-by-the-slice place, in a high-end Las Vegas casino.  For anyone coming from New York, the pizza will be no better or worse than your average local, while for anyone coming from anywhere else, it'll be pretty good (not great, but pretty good).  The price will be several times as high either way ($15.25 bought me a cheese slice, a veggie slice, and a diet coke), but again, you're in a high-end Las Vegas casino, and the extra $6-10 seems worth the hassle of not having to leave the strip.  Heck, compared to the $7 cup of Illy coffee and $16 sandwich you can have downstairs, or the $35 you'll spend on on a room service club sandwich (to say nothing of the $100 for mediocre sushi you can pay at Blue Ribbon next door), a satisfying, no-nonsense lunch for $10-$15 is the biggest bargain you're likely to find in CityCenter.

I love how this place is "hidden". How fun!

The white pizza is amazing and great for a quick snack or meal. Not a bad attempt at a New York Slice!

After living in Chicagoland for over 35 years, I can say this is some tasty pizza. I've been here several times after moving to Las Vegas and I can not stray away from the white pizza. Garlicky and cheesy goodness. 

Their pan pizza is mislabeled as Chicago deep dish. A big chunk of dough with cheese on top. At $8 a slice, it's a joke. I recommend buying two thin slices instead. 

Service is spotty, but what can you expect after serving hordes of drunk tourists for hours on end. A great late night snack on the Strip. Savor the flavor.
Delicious - 30 minute wait for a whole pie forced us to grab by the slice ... Not optimal, but all slices were delicious and great, fresh ingredients.
Great pizza. Reasonable. Get the meatball. Rather hidden.
Damn good p-za but, fyi its only one $ relative to the location. 6$ a slice? But if your drunk hungry and close, then its definitely worth it. Cheers
The best New York-style pizza in Vegas, on or off the strip. I know, that's not saying much... but yes, that's including Grimaldi's. Five bucks a slice is a bit steep, but hey, it's the Strip.
Love this place... This is truly the closest you'll get to New York quality pizza... when I'm home sick for NY pizza this is where you'll find me...

This place is a hidden gem in the Cosmopolitan Hotel!  Walk down a little hallway on the third floor and discover this treasure!  It is not mentioned or listed on any signs posted in the hotel, hence the name Secret Pizza. We ordered pepperoni and sausage, a white pizza, and a mushroom pizza for a party in a suite and we were not disappointed!  Delicious pizza!

The hubby and I both love this place. We've taken many friends and family here when they've come from out of town and everyone loves it. The pizza is great but i think they also dig the novelty of it being a "secret" place.

The white pizza is my favorite (is that what it's called?). My only complaint and the reason for not giving it 5 stars is because it doesn't taste too good cold or reheated the next day. I mean, who doesn't love cold pizza for breakfast?!? With this pizza its hot out if the oven or not at all for me.

This place is a HIDDEN gem.  Its so secret its not even on any of the maps or signs in the hotel.  The pizza is really good and made fresh if you want a whole pie and warmed up if you want by the slice, even warmed up it taste fresh.  They don't really serve drinks soda by the red cup, red bull , and a couple of bottled beer selections.  They have water which is serve yourself by the cup.  No tables all standing bar type set up.  The white slice is delicious and garlic tasting not overly but great flavor.  The pepperoni is also very tasty...next time going to try the sausage and pepperoni.

I've known about this not-so-secret establishment for about a year but was never afforded an opportunity to try it out until this last weekend.  After being bumped around and not being able to dance with my wife across the street at the Gallery Nightclub inside Planet Hollywood, we decided that we were at wits end and that pizza was the only thing that could make the night even better.  I suggested Secret Pizza to her and we started our trek.  We made a short jaunt to The Cosmopolitan and started our pizza pilgrimage.

The Yelpers before me did an excellent job at describing where the place was located and that helped a great deal because it would have taken me a while.   Secret Pizza is tricky to find because you're essentially looking for a hallway.  Once you get up the escalator on the third floor, you walk a little and turn to the left.  When you see the hallway, just walk toward the end and follow the incredible smell. 

I've had good pizza before as I've had it in just about any locale you can think of.  I've only been to NYC once and I remember how good it was there.  I can say with pure certainty that the "White Pizza" is quite possibly the best that I've had anywhere and that is monumental since I have this weird obsession with ranking EVERYTHING that I eat. 

If a long wait isn't too much of a deterrent then I can't recommend this place enough.

OMG this pizza is amazing!!!!!!! I have no idea why it is soooooo good...maybe because it is simple but its so delicious that I ate here more than any other place. Every time I go to vegas from now on I must stop by this place because I've never had any pizza this good in LA. It literally tastes like the pizza from teenage mutant ninja turtles looks like it should taste. The cheese is amazingly like stringy but does not take all the cheese with it to burn your mouth and the crust is light and airy with a satisfying crunch....do yourself a favor and try this place out!!!!!

Good-tasting, good-sized pizza. Perfect late night munchies! It's easy to miss, though. Look for the pool table on the 3rd floor close to a gallery with some nice wood furniture around it.. It's right down the hall.

The pizza was delicious! And not just because I was drunk:)

sooo good! We got there at 3 am something the line was so long. About 30 mins in we are getting antsy and saying maybe we should leave is it really worth waiting this long? It better be worth it! Next thing we know people start walking by with whole pies opening their boxes wafting the smell in to our faces saying oh yeah it's worth the wait. I think maybe an hour later or longer even, we finally got our pizza. We were starving at this point and ordered a whole pie. Half white and half pep and olive. We walk back down the hallway and everyone is cat calling our pizza. I felt a little guilty because I knew how long those people have to wait but not guilty enough I just kept it walking with my pizza ;) the white pizza is amazing!! I honestly never cared for ricotta but I don't know if it was the alcohol it just tasted amazing the dough is perfect. I was worried because some friends had it their 1st night here and said it was too greasy. I did not have that problem at all or maybe I can handle the grease a little more. The white pizza was absolute perfection.

Oh Secret Pizza. We meet again. 

I remember when the Cosmo first opened. My friends and I were...uh, inebriated, and we stumbled in here shoeless. 

I've had plenty of great memories with Secret Pizza since then. One time, we trekked from on side of the strip just for the pizza. I think that was at least a two mile walk.

Yeah, it was worth it and I'd do it again.

The cannoli's are my favorite. The pizzas, are duh- GREAT.

Great for when you're drunk, hungry, or in need of comfort food.

They really need to put a sign up, because this place is darn near impossible to find without asking someone.  Maybe it's their secret way of keeping the place hidden and away from all the tourists.   Just find the public billiard table in the open floor, and then look for a long dark hallway which seems like it's a private entrance for staff.  Once you walk the long dark hallway, you will walk into a small pizza shop, and the smell of fresh pizza will immediately engulf you!

My friends split a cheese pizza, white pizza, and a pepperoni, olive, and mushroom pizza.  The line can get long, so be prepared to wait!  Once you order, the server will take your slice of pizza and bake it in the oven for a few minutes to get it nice and melty.  I believe a pizza slice comes out to be around $4 per slice.  I thought the price was slightly high since it was a super thin crust, and the slices didn't seem all that big.   The pizza was pretty good, but definitely not as good as the stuff served in NY.  I did not care for the white pizza, but the cheese and pepperoni pizza was pretty good.   Also, the crust was slightly chewy, which I did not like, but I really liked the cheese and spices they topped on the pizza.  One slice of pizza is like an appetizer, so I would suggest you order 2-3 slices a person, if you want to actually get filled up or eat it as a dinner.    I'd come back for a late night snack or an afternoon appetizer if I'm in the area, but it's not something I would walk from Wynn to Cosmo to eat.  Pretty good pizza, but not good enough to crave, especially with all the other eats in Vegas.

Hidden little pizza joint inside Cosmo.  The pizza is really bad in my opinion, the cheese sucks and it's extremely greasy, just completely covered in grease.  Me and my buddy both at half of our slices and threw out the rest.
Pizza is true New York style pizza...thin crust and super hot and full of flavor....hidden on 3rs floor of Cosmopolitan...perfect late night snack

This not so secret pizza place is amazing!

With fresh pies rolling out all night it's worth the wait.
Even if you're completely sober!

We didn't wait long at all, but right after we selected our pieces the line went down the hallway.

The staff there are completely friendly and help you out with ordering if it's your first time.

A small selection of draft beers and soft drinks are available to accompany your slice.

Cheesecake and salads are also options.

Whether you choose a pre made slice or create your own, it's a must go when on the strip!

Shhhhhhhhhhhhhhh....it's a secret. 

Great pizza! We got a few cheese and pepperoni slices to-go and they didn't make it very far. As soon as we got to the car...down the hatch. Thin NY Style Pizza done RIGHT! Not to greasy, not to dry, perfect size for the "fold-in-hand" style eating. Price was good, the counter staff was super nice. Excellent. We will certainly be back. Come hungry, don't expect to sit, if you do; eat then get out so others can sit - no lollygagging!

At first i was intrigued why it's called "secret pizza" and now i know why  its for you guys to find out! You absolutely should come if you're visiting las vegas! One of the best pizzas I've eaten! There's so much goodness for a cheap price.

One of the few grab and go spots in the hotel but worth grabbing a few slices, especially if you're stomach only has liquid in it. They serve both red and white sauced pizza and they warm it up in the oven as you order it. I'm not sure if it tasted super great because I was hungry or if it just plain tasted great but I will definitely give it another go when at the Cosmo.

So I keep hearing how "amazing" this place is... I'm not a pizza snob by any means, but I just did not have a religious experience. I think the allure of this place is its anonymity. But the pizza... tastes like pizza! Nothing crazy nor fancy. Would I eat the pizza again? If someone brought it to me sure. Would I go out of my way to specifically find this place? Not at all, I probably won't ever eat here again. I ate half of their cheese and half of their white, again not saying it's bad. It's pizza! Can't mess that up too badly, but it was nothing special in my opinion!! Save a trip, nothing amazing in my opinion. Just FYI it's more of a to go place. Nowhere to sit. Just stand.

Call ahead and order a pizza! 

Secret is a solid pizza place and probably isn't much of a secret anymore but you will find that it's a hole in the wall with a long line leading through it. The pizza is pretty darn amazing after a long night. 

How it works is you wait in line and when you get to the front you can either create your own and order a whole pizza or you can choose from the slices they have out. Somewhat greasy but when it's 4AM, who gives a damn! Honestly you can't go wrong with any of the precut slices. The line also moves at a decent pace so don't be scared, it really isn't bad.

Definitely slightly pricey for pizza but it's the strip and basically one of the few places for cheap eats on the strip. Only warning is if you don't like ricotta, make sure to order a slice without ricotta.
The White Slice is to die for. So good and awesome , friendly service. Definitely will return .

Clearly no longer a secret...but for you first timers. It's up the stairs. 
Pizza isn't anything to write home about but definitely hits the spot. The place is out if the way and gives you a break from everything else Vegas has to offer. 
Oh and did I mention the place is cheap! $10 gets you a slice and a beer and leaves a decent tip in the jar.

Pizza is decent, and it being "secret' is fun, but it tastes MUCH better if you are drunk.  White pizza was tasty (not the best I've ever had), and the price for a place on the strip is good.  It's open late, which is great for a late night treat, but I wouldn't wait in a huge line for a slice.

If you want to get a drink here, go with a beer on draft - they even come in a red solo cup!  The box wine is disgusting...but that was my mistake for even ordering it.

Here's the secret...it ain't that good.
I really wonder who these yelpers are. 
Ok, it's a decent slice from a place that's good to know about given the expense & absurdity of the strip. That's why 2 stars becomes a 3...but NOT a 4.

If this place were transplanted to NYC: 
- no one would notice because the same place is on every corner, 
- there might not even be any yelps of it, and 
- the place would be very lucky to get 3 stars

...but, it's not in the Big Apple, it's on the Big Strip.

I don't know what the fuss about this place is about...

We waited 1.5 hours for a couple slices of pizza. The line wasn't even long at all. We were maybe 15 people deep. This place is just extremely inefficiently set up. The guys are jumping around everywhere to grab a pizza, grab toppings, throw it in the oven, grab parmesan, etc...

The pizza itself was decent but waiting 1.5 hours for 2 slices...
Hard to find so ask around..the secret is that it is hidden w/out signs to point you in the right direction so do ask..worth the time.
Their prices just keep rising every year.. it used to cost 25$ for a deluxe pie, now it's almost $40!

This place is pretty easy to find.  Just go up the escalator to the 3rd floor and you can see the "hidden" passageway.  

The place is relatively small with counters along the side for you to eat your pizza and go.  I thought the pizza was pretty standard.  It didn't taste particularly amazing to me, but maybe its just me.  

I thought their prices were pretty steep for a whole pie.  Be prepared to wait if you decide to go this route.  There are some pin ball machines that can entertain you while you wait.  Individual slices seem like the better and faster deal.  Soda is served in a red dixie cup and not worth what they charge.

Stopped in for a weekday lunch. There was a small crowd when we arrived. No menus here. Slices start at $3.00 and it's 50-cents for additional toppings. A full pie is $17. Pizzas are pre-cooked, you make your selection based on what's available and it's tossed in the pizza oven for a few minutes to heat it through and crisp the crust.

We tried the pepperoni, the onions and peppers, the white pizza and the sausage and meatball. The total with two diet cokes was 22.16.

We stood at the counter and enjoyed our slices. Nicely crisp (slight char) chewy crust, light sauce and gooey cheese. The least favorite slice was the sausage and meatball -- bland meats. The favorite was the onion and pepper slice.

Mouth. Watering. Pizza. 

I can't tell you how good this pizza is. It's a great combination of salty and cheesy goodness. I always get either a slice of their mushroom pizza or white pizza. Their mushroom pizza is delicious + a little bit of added chili flakes makes the saltiness of the pizza all come together for a flavorful bite. Their white pizza is probably one of their more famous pies and with good reason, it's delicious! It's a mozzarella (and parmesan?) based slice topped with ricotta cheese. At first, I thought it would be too much cheese for my liking but it all somehow comes together as cheesy goodness.  Now, the crust...it's all about the crust!! The pizza itself is thin with a slight crunchy bite to it. The crust is crispy but with a doughy inside that I love. The slices run pretty big so it's worth the price! ($5/6) Usually all it takes is one slice for me to be done, two if I'm super hungry. I've never had to wait in a long line to place my order (my wait is usually like 5 mins) but I've been told it can get pretty crazy late night when the clubs close. 
My only complaint about the pizza is that it can be a little too oily. Seeing small puddles of greasiness is kind of gross, but nothing a pat down with a napkin won't fix. Just wish I didn't have to perform this messy task before eating it. 

Seating is available inside (best for parties of 2, not so much for bigger parties) & all around the lounge type area but it can be difficult to find an open space during a busy night. The pizzeria itself is located on the 3rd floor of Cosmo, down a hallway across from the escalators.

I'm pretty sure that the secret is out because the line was all the way down the hall and around the corner. However, I get why people are willing to wait in a line like that at 2AM. This pizza is exactly what you need in the middle of the night before passing out or rallying before hitting up another club. It is pretty pricey for one slice, but whatever, it is Vegas Strip. I will be coming here for every Vegas trip from now on because its just the kind of place that you have to hit up.
Awesome pizza. I don't usually eat my crusts but I ate every bit of these. Try the white pizza even if you don't normally like white, it's so good.
The late night-earrly morning adventure was half the fun! Loved the hunt for the location and pizza was good

One of the best deals in Vegas! Tucked down a small hallway on the 3rd floor of the Cosmo, this inconspicuous little pizza joint is the perfect spot to indulge a late night craving. 

Slices are $3-5 each and worth it. The pizza is thin crust and packs a great flavor. There are about half a dozen choices ready or you can order a full pie. Grab a beer and a slice or two and you've got a great meal! Wait time was less than 5 minutes at 9pm on a Monday night.
